fetchPools.name: fetchPools
fetchPools.description: Fetch token pools from Gala Launchpad with filtering and pagination.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of pools to fetch (default: recent). "recordings" sorts by recording count DESC, "seconds_streamed" sorts by total stream time DESC.

parameters.name: hasUpcomingShows
parameters.description: Filter pools with nextLiveStreamAt in the future (has upcoming scheduled shows).

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Filter pools by stream language (ISO 639-1 code, e.g., "en", "es", "ja", "zh-CN").

parameters.name: recentlyStreamed
parameters.description: Filter pools that have streamed within the last N hours (e.g., 24 for last day, 168 for last week, max 720 for 30 days).

parameters.name: hasRecordings
parameters.description: Filter pools with at least one recording (recordingsCount > 0).

parameters.name: streamStatus
parameters.description: Filter pools by stream status. IDLE = stream key exists but not broadcasting, ACTIVE = currently live, DISABLED = stream disabled by admin/overseer. Useful for CCTV monitoring.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

fetchAllPools.name: fetchAllPools
fetchAllPools.description: Fetch all available pools with automatic pagination. No page/limit parameters needed - returns ALL pools matching filters. Note: For search functionality, use gala_launchpad_fetch_pools (paginated version) instead.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of pools to fetch (default: recent). "recordings" sorts by recording count DESC, "seconds_streamed" sorts by total stream time DESC.

parameters.name: hasUpcomingShows
parameters.description: Filter pools with nextLiveStreamAt in the future (has upcoming scheduled shows).

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Filter pools by stream language (ISO 639-1 code, e.g., "en", "es", "ja", "zh-CN").

parameters.name: recentlyStreamed
parameters.description: Filter pools that have streamed within the last N hours (e.g., 24 for last day, 168 for last week, max 720 for 30 days).

parameters.name: hasRecordings
parameters.description: Filter pools with at least one recording (recordingsCount > 0).

parameters.name: streamStatus
parameters.description: Filter pools by stream status. IDLE = stream key exists but not broadcasting, ACTIVE = currently live, DISABLED = stream disabled by admin/overseer. Useful for CCTV monitoring.

fetchPoolDetails.name: fetchPoolDetails
fetchPoolDetails.description: Get detailed pool state from GalaChain bonding curve.

fetchPoolDetailsForCalculation.name: fetchPoolDetailsForCalculation
fetchPoolDetailsForCalculation.description:
Get optimized pool details for local bonding curve calculations.

Returns only essential calculation parameters:
- currentSupply: Current token supply (computed with full precision)
- remainingTokens: Tokens available for purchase
- maxSupply: Maximum token supply
- reverseBondingCurveMaxFeeFactor: Maximum reverse bonding curve fee (normalized to number)
- reverseBondingCurveMinFeeFactor: Minimum reverse bonding curve fee (normalized to number)
- reverseBondingCurveNetFeeFactor: Net fee factor (max - min, for convenience)

This is more efficient than fetchPoolDetails as it returns only fields needed for calculations.
Perfect for use with calculateBuyAmountLocal and calculateSellAmountLocal.

fetchTokenDetails.name: fetchTokenDetails
fetchTokenDetails.description:
Fetch comprehensive token details from DEX API platform

**Endpoint:** `/v1/tokens?tokenclasskeys=...`

**Requirements:**
- DEX API platform must be configured (dexApiHttp client)
- Token identifier required in flexible format (string or object)

**Use Cases:**
- Retrieve complete token metadata and information
- Verify token specifications (decimals, symbol, description)
- Check verification status and trading capabilities
- Access token image and network information
- Analyze token details before trading

**Flexible Token Identification:**
Supports both pipe-delimited string and object formats for maximum flexibility.

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: Token identifier in flexible format (string or object).

fetchTokenDistribution.name: fetchTokenDistribution
fetchTokenDistribution.description: Get holder distribution and supply metrics.

fetchUserHolderContext.name: fetchUserHolderContext
fetchUserHolderContext.description:
Get a user's holder context for a specific token.

Returns holder tier, quantity, percentage, rank, and creator status for a user on a specific token.
Used for user cards in comments/chat to show token-specific holder information.
Returns null if user is not a holder (quantity/percentage/rank/holderTier fields will be null).

RETURNS: { tokenName, userAddress, quantity, percentage, rank, holderTier: { tier, tierName }, isCreator }

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: User wallet address to lookup holder context for.

fetchTokenBadges.name: fetchTokenBadges
fetchTokenBadges.description: Get achievement badges for volume and engagement.

fetchVolumeData.name: fetchVolumeData
fetchVolumeData.description: Get OHLCV (candlestick) data for charting. Returns array of candles with open, high, low, close prices and volume for each time period.

fetchTokenSpotPrice.name: fetchTokenSpotPrice
fetchTokenSpotPrice.description:
Fetch USD spot price for ANY token with smart routing

Routes to the correct backend automatically:
- **tokenName** â†’ Launchpad token (detects graduation status)
- **tokenId** â†’ DEX token via /v1/trade/price endpoint.

parameters.name: tokenId

parameters.name: calculateAmountMode

Use CALCULATION_MODES.LOCAL for instant client-side calculations.
Use CALCULATION_MODES.EXTERNAL for network-based GalaChain calculations.

fetchGalaSpotPrice.description: Fetch current GALA USD spot price (convenience method).

fetchPriceHistory.name: fetchPriceHistory
fetchPriceHistory.description:
Fetch historical price snapshots for DEX tokens from the DEX Backend API.

**Endpoint:** `/price-oracle/fetch-price`

**Requirements:**
- DEX Backend API must be configured (dexBackendBaseUrl in SDK config)
- Node.js environment only (not available in browser)
- Either tokenName OR tokenId is required (not both)

**Token Identification:**
- Use `tokenName` for convenience (e.g., "demonkpop") - automatically resolved to full token ID
- Use `tokenId` for direct specification (e.g., "Token|Unit|DKP|eth:...")
- Provide exactly ONE of these parameters

**Use Cases:**
- Historical price analysis and charting
- Price trend identification
- Volatility analysis over time periods
- Data export for external analytics

**Performance:** API-based queries with pagination support (max 50 items per page).

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Simple token name for convenience (e.g., "demonkpop", "shoewars") - automatically resolves to full token ID. Use this OR tokenId, not both.

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: Token identifier (string or TokenClassKey object). Use this OR tokenName, not both.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date for filtering (ISO 8601 format, defaults to 30 days ago).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date for filtering (ISO 8601 format, defaults to now).

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Sort order for results (default: DESC for newest-first).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

fetchAllPriceHistory.name: fetchAllPriceHistory
fetchAllPriceHistory.description:
Fetch all historical price snapshots for DEX tokens from the DEX Backend API with automatic pagination.

**Endpoint:** `/price-oracle/fetch-price`

**Requirements:**
- DEX Backend API must be configured (dexBackendBaseUrl in SDK config)
- Node.js environment only (not available in browser)
- Either tokenName OR tokenId is required (not both)

**Token Identification:**
- Use `tokenName` for convenience (e.g., "demonkpop") - automatically resolved to full token ID
- Use `tokenId` for direct specification (e.g., "Token|Unit|DKP|eth:...")
- Provide exactly ONE of these parameters

**Use Cases:**
- Complete historical price analysis and charting
- Full price trend identification over time periods
- Comprehensive volatility analysis
- Data export for external analytics

**Performance:** API-based queries with automatic pagination (max 100 items per page, combined into single result).

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Simple token name for convenience (e.g., "demonkpop", "shoewars") - automatically resolves to full token ID. Use this OR tokenId, not both.

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: Token identifier (string or TokenClassKey object). Use this OR tokenName, not both.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date for filtering (ISO 8601 format, defaults to 30 days ago).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date for filtering (ISO 8601 format, defaults to now).

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Sort order for results (default: DESC for newest-first).

checkTokenSymbol.description: Check if token symbol is available.

validateToken.name: validateToken
validateToken.description:
Validate if token name and/or symbol are available for use.

Check name and symbol availability before launching a token. Returns availability flags
and any validation errors. Useful for token creation forms to prevent invalid submissions.

RETURNS: { nameAvailable, symbolAvailable, nameBlocklisted, symbolBlocklisted, errors: [] }

Authentication: None required (public endpoint)

resolveVaultAddress.name: resolveVaultAddress
resolveVaultAddress.description:
**DO NOT GUESS** - Resolve a launchpad token name to its GalaChain vault address.

The vault address format is NOT derivable from the token name. You MUST use this tool.

Results are cached for performance - subsequent calls are instant.

resolveTokenClassKey.name: resolveTokenClassKey
resolveTokenClassKey.description:
**MANDATORY** - Convert a launchpad token name to its GalaChain TokenClassKey.

âš ï¸ DO NOT GUESS OR CONSTRUCT TokenClassKey FROM TOKEN NAME!

The relationship is NOT predictable:
- Token "anime" might have type "ANM", not "ANIME"
- Token "dragon" might have type "DRG", not "DRAGON"
- The additionalKey contains creator's ETH address (IMPOSSIBLE to guess)

ALWAYS use this tool before any operation requiring TokenClassKey.
Results are cached - subsequent calls are instant.

fetchTokenClassesWithSupply.name: fetchTokenClassesWithSupply
fetchTokenClassesWithSupply.description: Fetch supply metrics for multiple token classes in a single batch query. Returns totalSupply, maxSupply, and totalBurned for each token. Efficient for portfolio analysis.

parameters.name: tokenClasses
parameters.description: Array of TokenClassKey objects to query supply for.

checkPoolExists.description:
Check if a pool exists for a token.

Convenience method that checks pool existence by token name or symbol.
At least one parameter is required.

onPoolUpdated.name: onPoolUpdated
onPoolUpdated.description:
Watch for pool metadata updates in real-time.

Triggers when pool metadata, social links, or badges are updated. Includes:
- POOL_METADATA_UPDATED: Name, description, image, category changes
- POOL_SOCIAL_LINKS_UPDATED: Website, Discord, Twitter, etc. changes
- POOL_BADGE_ASSIGNED: New badges or badge assignments

Returns:
- poolsUpdated: Number of pool updates detected
- updates: Array of pool update events with tokenName, updateType, and metadata changes

Filter Options:
- tokenName: Only watch updates for a specific token
- updateType: Filter by type ('METADATA', 'SOCIAL_LINKS', or 'BADGE_ASSIGNED').

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Only watch updates for this token (optional).

parameters.name: durationSeconds
parameters.description: How long to watch for new events in seconds (default: 60).

getPoolRealtimeState.name: getPoolRealtimeState
getPoolRealtimeState.description:
Get combined real-time state of a pool.

Returns a comprehensive snapshot of current pool state including:
- Holder count and distribution
- Stream status (ACTIVE/IDLE/DISABLED)
- Chat status and active moderators
- Recent trades (last 24 hours)
- Price and volume metrics
- Social links and metadata updates

Useful for dashboards, monitoring, and real-time analytics.

Returns: Object with holderCount, streamStatus, chatStatus, recentTrades[], priceData, and other metrics.

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: The token name to get state for.

onHolderCountChanged.name: onHolderCountChanged
onHolderCountChanged.description:
Watch for token holder count changes in real-time.

Triggers whenever the holder count for a token changes, including:
- New holders making their first purchase
- Holders liquidating their entire position
- Changes in holder distribution and tiers

Returns:
- holdersChanged: Number of holder count change events detected
- events: Array of holder count events with tokenName, newCount, previousCount, and timestamp

Filter Options:
- tokenName: Only watch holder changes for a specific token
- minThreshold: Only notify if holder count changes by >= minThreshold.

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Only watch holder changes for this token (optional).

parameters.name: minThreshold
parameters.description: Only notify if holder count changes by at least this amount (optional).

parameters.name: durationSeconds
parameters.description: How long to watch for new events in seconds (default: 60).

**Authorization:**

parameters.name: messagesEnabled
parameters.description: Enable/disable chat messages for this token.

parameters.name: nextLiveStreamAt
parameters.description: Schedule next live stream (ISO 8601 datetime or null to clear).

calculateBuyAmount.name: calculateBuyAmount
calculateBuyAmount.description:
Calculate token amounts for buying with fee breakdown.

PARAMETERS:
- type: 'native' (spend GALA) or 'exact' (buy token amount)
- amount: Spend amount (native) or token quantity (exact)

RETURNS:
- amount: Exact token amount to receive
- totalCost: GALA needed (amount + all fees)
- transactionFee: Gas fee (1 GALA)
- reverseBondingCurveFee: Dynamic pool fee (min-max range).

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount in standard decimal format (e.g., "1" for 1 GALA).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Trade calculation type:

- 'native': You specify GALA amount to spend
  Example: "I want to spend 10 GALA to buy tokens" -> type: 'native', amount: '10'

- 'exact': You specify exact token amount to buy
  Example: "I want to buy exactly 1000 WOO tokens" -> type: 'exact', amount: '1000'

Most common: Use 'native' when you know how much GALA to spend.

calculateSellAmount.name: calculateSellAmount
calculateSellAmount.description:
Calculate GALA amounts for selling tokens.

PARAMETERS:
- type: 'native' (receive GALA amount) or 'exact' (sell token amount)
- amount: GALA desired (native) or tokens to sell (exact)

RETURNS:
- amount: GALA received after all deductions
- totalCost: Tokens needed (amount + reverse fee)
- transactionFee: Gas fee (1 GALA deducted from amount)
- reverseBondingCurveFee: Dynamic pool fee applied to sale.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount in standard decimal format (e.g., "1" for 1 GALA)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Trade calculation type:

- 'native': You specify GALA amount you want to receive
  Example: "I want to receive 10 GALA from selling tokens" -> type: 'native', amount: '10'

- 'exact': You specify exact token amount to sell
  Example: "I want to sell exactly 1000 WOO tokens" -> type: 'exact', amount: '1000'

Most common: Use 'native' when you know how much GALA you want to receive.

buy.name: buy
buy.description:
Execute token purchase with slippage protection.

WORKFLOW:
1. calculateBuyAmount() -> Get expected output (result.amount AND result.reverseBondingCurveFee)
2. buy() -> Execute trade with BOTH expectedAmount AND maxAcceptableReverseBondingCurveFee
3. fetchTrades() -> Verify trade completed

CRITICAL: Extract BOTH parameters from calculateBuyAmount:
- result.amount -> expectedAmount
- result.reverseBondingCurveFee -> maxAcceptableReverseBondingCurveFee
Omitting reverseBondingCurveFee may cause transaction failures!

RETURNS: Transaction details including input/output amounts and transaction ID.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Trade type (must match what you used in calculateBuyAmount):

- 'native': Spending GALA amount
- 'exact': Buying exact token amount.

parameters.name: expectedAmount
maxAcceptableReverseBondingCurveFee
parameters.description: RECOMMENDED: Base reverse bonding curve fee from calculateBuyAmount (GALA). Use result.reverseBondingCurveFee. Omitting this may cause transaction failures. Works with maxAcceptableReverseBondingCurveFeeSlippageFactor for automatic slippage adjustment.

parameters.name: maxAcceptableReverseBondingCurveFeeSlippageFactor
parameters.description: Optional slippage tolerance for reverse bonding curve fee (decimal, e.g., 0.01 for 1%). Defaults to 0.01 (1%) if not provided. Applied to maxAcceptableReverseBondingCurveFee to increase max acceptable fee.

parameters.name: privateKey
parameters.description: Optional private key override for this operation (format: "0x" + 64 hex characters). If provided, uses this wallet instead of the default MCP server wallet.

sell.name: sell
sell.description:
Execute token sale with slippage protection.

WORKFLOW:
1. calculateSellAmount() -> Get expected output (result.amount AND result.reverseBondingCurveFee)
2. sell() -> Execute trade with BOTH expectedAmount AND maxAcceptableReverseBondingCurveFee
3. fetchTrades() -> Verify trade completed

CRITICAL: Extract BOTH parameters from calculateSellAmount:
- result.amount -> expectedAmount
- result.reverseBondingCurveFee -> maxAcceptableReverseBondingCurveFee
Omitting reverseBondingCurveFee may cause transaction failures!

RETURNS: Transaction details including input/output amounts and transaction ID.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Trade type (must match what you used in calculateSellAmount):

- 'native': Receiving GALA amount
- 'exact': Selling exact token amount.

parameters.name: expectedAmount
maxAcceptableReverseBondingCurveFee
parameters.description: RECOMMENDED: Base reverse bonding curve fee from calculateSellAmount (GALA). Use result.reverseBondingCurveFee. Omitting this may cause transaction failures. Works with maxAcceptableReverseBondingCurveFeeSlippageFactor for automatic slippage adjustment.

parameters.name: maxAcceptableReverseBondingCurveFeeSlippageFactor
parameters.description: Optional slippage tolerance for reverse bonding curve fee (decimal, e.g., 0.01 for 1%). Defaults to 0.01 (1%) if not provided. Applied to maxAcceptableReverseBondingCurveFee to increase max acceptable fee.

parameters.name: privateKey
parameters.description: Optional private key override for this operation (format: "0x" + 64 hex characters). If provided, uses this wallet instead of the default MCP server wallet.

fetchTrades.name: fetchTrades
fetchTrades.description:
Get trade history with optional filtering and pagination.

PARAMETERS:
- tradeType: 'buy' (purchases only) or 'sell' (sales only) - optional filter
- userAddress: Filter by specific wallet address (optional)
- startDate/endDate: Filter by date range (optional, ISO 8601 format)

RETURNS:
- trades[]: Array of trades with:
  - txHash: Transaction ID
  - type: 'buy' or 'sell'
  - amount: Token quantity
  - price: GALA paid/received
  - timestamp: When executed.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

calculateInitialBuy.name: calculateInitialBuy
calculateInitialBuy.description: Calculate amounts for initial token purchase during creation (pre-mint phase).

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: GALA amount to spend for initial buy (standard decimal format, e.g., "100" for 100 GALA).

getBundlerTransactionResult.name: getBundlerTransactionResult
getBundlerTransactionResult.description:
Get bundle transaction result by ID via HTTP (not WebSocket).

Returns lightweight status: { id: string, method: string, status: string }

Status values: "COMPLETED", "FAILED", "PENDING", "PROCESSING"

Use cases:
- Check transaction status when WebSocket times out
- Get definitive transaction state
- Verify trade/launch completion

Note: This is a synchronous HTTP call, not WebSocket monitoring.

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: Transaction ID (UUID format) from buy(), sell(), or launchToken()

calculateBuyAmountForGraduation.name: calculateBuyAmountForGraduation
calculateBuyAmountForGraduation.description:
Calculate amount needed to graduate a token pool.

Convenience method that:
1. Fetches pool details to get remaining tokens
2. Calls calculateBuyAmount with exact remaining amount
3. Returns standard AmountCalculationResult

Performance optimization: Provide currentSupply to avoid fetching pool details twice.

RETURNS: Same as calculateBuyAmount - complete cost breakdown including
totalCost, amount, transactionFee, gasFee, reverseBondingCurveFee.

parameters.name: calculateAmountMode
parameters.description:
Calculation mode override (optional - defaults to SDK's calculateAmountMode).
Use CALCULATION_MODES.LOCAL for instant client-side calculations.
Use CALCULATION_MODES.EXTERNAL for network-based GalaChain calculations.

parameters.name: currentSupply
parameters.description: Current token supply (optional - only used for local mode, auto-fetched if missing).

graduateToken.name: graduateToken
graduateToken.description:
Graduate a token pool by buying all remaining tokens in one transaction.

WORKFLOW (automatic):
1. Calls calculateBuyAmountForGraduation() internally
2. Executes buy() with exact remaining token amount
3. Returns transaction result

Performance optimization: Provide currentSupply to avoid fetching pool details twice.

CRITICAL: This is a convenience method that combines multiple operations.
Throws error if token is already graduated.
slippageToleranceFactor is optional and uses SDK defaults if not provided.

RETURNS: TradeResult with transaction details including amounts and transaction ID.

parameters.name: maxAcceptableReverseBondingCurveFeeSlippageFactor
parameters.description: Optional slippage tolerance for reverse bonding curve fee (decimal, e.g., 0.01 for 1%). Defaults to 0.01 (1%) if not provided. Applied to maxAcceptableReverseBondingCurveFee to increase max acceptable fee.

parameters.name: privateKey
parameters.description: Optional private key override for this operation (format: "0x" + 64 hex characters). If provided, uses this wallet instead of the default MCP server wallet.

parameters.name: calculateAmountMode
parameters.description:
Calculation mode override (optional - defaults to SDK's calculateAmountMode).
Use CALCULATION_MODES.LOCAL for instant client-side calculations.
Use CALCULATION_MODES.EXTERNAL for network-based GalaChain calculations.

parameters.name: currentSupply
parameters.description: Current token supply (optional - only used for local mode, auto-fetched if missing).

calculateBuyAmountLocal.name: calculateBuyAmountLocal
calculateBuyAmountLocal.description:
Calculate buy amounts using LOCAL bonding curve formulas (instant, no network call).

Uses client-side exponential bonding curve calculations for instant quotes.
Perfect for price discovery, UI updates, and offline scenarios.

ACCURACY: Matches external calculations with <0.01% difference.

RETURNS: { amount, reverseBondingCurveFee: "0", transactionFee, gasFee }

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount in standard decimal format (e.g., "1" for 1 GALA).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Trade calculation type:
- 'native': Spend GALA amount
- 'exact': Buy exact token amount.

calculateBuyAmountExternal.name: calculateBuyAmountExternal
calculateBuyAmountExternal.description:
Calculate buy amounts using EXTERNAL GalaChain network call (real-time).

Explicit external calculation - queries GalaChain network for real-time pricing.
Identical to calculateBuyAmount but makes the network dependency explicit.

RETURNS: { amount, reverseBondingCurveFee, transactionFee, gasFee }

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount in standard decimal format (e.g., "1" for 1 GALA).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Trade calculation type:
- 'native': Spend GALA amount
- 'exact': Buy exact token amount.

calculateSellAmountLocal.name: calculateSellAmountLocal
calculateSellAmountLocal.description:
Calculate sell amounts using LOCAL bonding curve formulas (instant, no network call).

Uses client-side calculations with reverse bonding curve fee support.
Requires pool details (maxSupply, fee parameters) to calculate accurately.

ACCURACY: Matches external calculations with <0.01% difference.

RETURNS: { amount, reverseBondingCurveFee, transactionFee, gasFee }

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Trade calculation type:
- 'native': Receive GALA amount
- 'exact': Sell exact token amount.

parameters.name: reverseBondingCurveMinFeeFactor
parameters.description: Min reverse bonding curve fee factor (get from poolDetails.reverseBondingCurveMinFeeFactor).

parameters.name: reverseBondingCurveMaxFeeFactor
parameters.description: Max reverse bonding curve fee factor (get from poolDetails.reverseBondingCurveMaxFeeFactor).

calculateSellAmountExternal.name: calculateSellAmountExternal
calculateSellAmountExternal.description:
Calculate sell amounts using EXTERNAL GalaChain network call (real-time).

Explicit external calculation - queries GalaChain network for real-time pricing.
Identical to calculateSellAmount but makes the network dependency explicit.

RETURNS: { amount, reverseBondingCurveFee, transactionFee, gasFee }

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Trade calculation type:
- 'native': Receive GALA amount
- 'exact': Sell exact token amount.

getSwapQuoteExactInput.name: getSwapQuoteExactInput
getSwapQuoteExactInput.description: Get swap quote for exact input amount - specify how much you want to spend. Returns estimated output amount, fee tier, and price impact percentage.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount of source token to spend.

getSwapQuoteExactOutput.name: getSwapQuoteExactOutput
getSwapQuoteExactOutput.description: Get swap quote for exact output amount - specify how much you want to receive. Returns required input amount, fee tier, and price impact percentage.

calculateDexPoolQuoteLocal.name: calculateDexPoolQuoteLocal
calculateDexPoolQuoteLocal.description: Calculate instant DEX quote using local bonding curve math. Auto-fetches pool data unless compositePoolData is provided (for bulk efficiency).

parameters.name: compositePoolData

calculateDexPoolQuoteExternal.name: calculateDexPoolQuoteExternal

1. checkTokenName() â†’ Verify name is available

3. launchToken() â†’ Create token with validated name/symbol
4. getUrlByTokenName() â†’ Get frontend URL for the new token

REQUIREMENT: At least one social URL (websiteUrl, twitterUrl, or telegramUrl) is required.

lockTokens.name: lockTokens
lockTokens.description:
Lock one or more token types on GalaChain in a single transaction.

Locked tokens cannot be transferred until unlocked by the lock authority.
Useful for staking, escrow, vesting, or other hold scenarios.

Supports batch locking of multiple token types for efficiency.

parameters.name: tokens
parameters.description: Array of tokens to lock (each with tokenId or tokenName, amount, and optional lock settings)

parameters.name: privateKey
parameters.description: Optional private key override for this operation (format: "0x" + 64 hex characters). If provided, uses this wallet instead of the default MCP server wallet.

unlockTokens.name: unlockTokens
unlockTokens.description:
Unlock one or more previously locked token types on GalaChain in a single transaction.

Releases token holds, making them available for transfer again.
Must be called by the lock authority (the address that locked the tokens
or was designated as lock authority during the lock operation).

Supports batch unlocking of multiple token types for efficiency.

parameters.name: tokens
parameters.description: Array of tokens to unlock (each with tokenId or tokenName, amount, and optional name)

parameters.name: privateKey
parameters.description: Optional private key override for this operation (format: "0x" + 64 hex characters). If provided, uses this wallet instead of the default MCP server wallet.

burnTokens.name: burnTokens
burnTokens.description:
Permanently burn (destroy) one or more token types on GalaChain in a single transaction.

**WARNING: THIS OPERATION IS IRREVERSIBLE!**

Once tokens are burned, they are permanently destroyed and cannot be recovered.
The burned tokens are removed from circulation, reducing total supply.

Supports batch burning of multiple token types in a single transaction.

parameters.name: tokens
parameters.description: Array of tokens to burn (each with tokenId or tokenName, and amount)

parameters.name: privateKey
parameters.description: Optional private key override for this operation (format: "0x" + 64 hex characters). If provided, uses this wallet instead of the default MCP server wallet.

explainSdkUsage.name: explainSdkUsage
explainSdkUsage.description: Get detailed SDK code examples for all 224 MCP tools (mapping to ~208 SDK methods) organized into 51 composite workflow topics covering: buy-tokens, sell-tokens, pool-graduation, fetch-pools, balances, token-creation, token-status, dex-trading, liquidity-positions, advanced-dex-analysis, price-history, token-details, token-distribution, profile-management, multi-wallet, transfers, locks, trading-analytics, utilities-and-helpers, utilities-system, error-handling, installation, local-calculations, spot-prices-smart-routing, event-subscriptions, mcp-to-sdk-mapping, DEX leaderboards, bridge-operations, dex-token-discovery, wrap-unwrap-operations, referral-system, account-management, session-auth, streaming, stream-chat, ban-management, api-key-management, moderator-invites, overseer-invites, content-flag-management, content-reactions, trade-history, token-ban-management, nft-collection-management, token-identification (explains tokenName vs tokenClassKey formats), and graduation-detection (how to check if a token has graduated from bonding curve to DEX).

parameters.name: topic

isTokenGraduated.name: isTokenGraduated

Check if a token has completed the bonding curve phase and graduated to full DEX trading.

RETURNS: Boolean indicating if pool saleStatus is "Completed"

USAGE: Useful for conditional logic before attempting graduation or checking pool state.

getVersion.name: getVersion

hasWallet.name: hasWallet

getPlatformStatus.name: getPlatformStatus
getPlatformStatus.description:
Get overall platform status and health metrics.

Returns comprehensive platform statistics including:
- Total active tokens
- Total active holders
- Total trade volume (24h, 7d, all-time)
- Online users and active streams
- System health indicators
- Recent platform events and announcements
- Maintenance status

Useful for dashboards, status pages, and real-time monitoring of platform health.

Returns: Object with activeTokens, activeHolders, tradeMetrics, onlineUsers, systemHealth, and recentEvents.

explainWebsocketEvents.name: explainWebsocketEvents
explainWebsocketEvents.description:
Get comprehensive documentation of all WebSocket events.

Lists and explains all 32+ real-time WebSocket events available on the Launchpad platform, including:

EVENT CATEGORIES:
1. Stream Events (STREAM_STATUS, RECORDING_STATUS, etc.)
2. Chat Events (STREAM_CHAT_SENT, CONTENT_REACTION_ADDED, etc.)
3. Trading Events (TRADE_EXECUTED)
4. Pool Events (POOL_METADATA_UPDATED, POOL_BADGE_ASSIGNED, HOLDER_COUNT_UPDATED)
5. Moderator Events (MODERATOR_ADDED, MODERATOR_REMOVED, MODERATOR_ROLE_UPDATED)
6. Moderation Events (USER_BANNED, USER_UNBANNED, BAN_ENFORCEMENT)
7. Ban Events (TOKEN_BANNED, TOKEN_UNBANNED)
8. Overseer Events (OVERSEER_ADDED, OVERSEER_REMOVED)
9. Comment Events (COMMENT_CREATED)
10. User Events (USER_PROFILE_UPDATED)
11. API Key Events (API_KEY_CREATED, API_KEY_UPDATED, API_KEY_REVOKED)

For each event:
- Description of what triggers it
- Room scope (token-specific, global, user-specific)
- Event payload structure
- Example JSON
- SDK subscription method
- MCP watcher tool
- Recommended filters

Returns: Detailed documentation of all events with examples and usage patterns.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter events by category (optional, default: all).

getEventSchema.name: getEventSchema
getEventSchema.description:
Get detailed schema/interface for a specific WebSocket event.

Returns TypeScript interface, JSON Schema validation, example payload, and documentation for any event.

EVENTS AVAILABLE:
Stream: STREAM_STATUS, RECORDING_STATUS, SIMULCAST_STATUS, DOWNLOAD_READY, STREAM_COUNTDOWN_UPDATED, STREAM_LANGUAGE_UPDATED
Chat: STREAM_CHAT_SENT, STREAM_CHAT_DELETED, STREAM_CHAT_PINNED, STREAM_CHAT_UNPINNED, CHAT_STATUS_CHANGED, STREAM_CONTROL_STATUS_CHANGED, CONTENT_REACTION_ADDED, CONTENT_REACTION_REMOVED, USER_TYPING, CONTENT_FLAGGED, FLAG_RESOLVED
Trading: TRADE_EXECUTED
Pool: POOL_METADATA_UPDATED, POOL_SOCIAL_LINKS_UPDATED, POOL_BADGE_ASSIGNED, HOLDER_COUNT_UPDATED
Moderation: MODERATOR_ADDED, MODERATOR_REMOVED, MODERATOR_ROLE_UPDATED, USER_BANNED, USER_UNBANNED, BAN_ENFORCEMENT
Ban: TOKEN_BANNED, TOKEN_UNBANNED
Overseer: OVERSEER_ADDED, OVERSEER_REMOVED
Comment: COMMENT_CREATED
User: USER_PROFILE_UPDATED
API Key: API_KEY_CREATED, API_KEY_UPDATED, API_KEY_REVOKED

Returns:
- TypeScript interface
- JSON Schema
- Example payload (minimum + full)
- Room scope (which room(s) this event is emitted to)
- Subscription method name
- Description and use cases.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: The name of the event (e.g., TRADE_EXECUTED, STREAM_STATUS, MODERATOR_ADDED).

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format for the schema (optional, default: both).

parameters.description: Token identifier in flexible format (string or object).

getBridgeStatus.name: getBridgeStatus
getBridgeStatus.description: Get the status of a bridge transaction by transaction hash. Returns status (pending/confirmed/failed), block number, and error details if applicable.

parameters.name: transactionHash
parameters.description: Transaction hash from bridgeOut or bridgeIn operation.

parameters.name: chainHint
parameters.description: Optional chain hint for faster lookup (Ethereum or Solana).

getSupportedBridgeTokens.name: getSupportedBridgeTokens
getSupportedBridgeTokens.description: Get list of tokens supported for bridging, optionally filtered by chain. Returns token details including decimals, supported chains, and contract addresses.

fetchEthereumWalletTokenBalance..name: fetchEthereumWalletTokenBalance.
fetchEthereumWalletTokenBalance..description: Get a single ERC-20 token balance on Ethereum (GALA, GWETH, GUSDC, GUSDT, GWTRX, GWBTC). Fast: only 1 RPC call.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Token symbol (GALA, GWETH, GUSDC, GUSDT, GWTRX, GWBTC).

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Ethereum address (0x format). Defaults to configured wallet address.

fetchEthereumWalletNativeBalance..name: fetchEthereumWalletNativeBalance.
fetchEthereumWalletNativeBalance..description: Get native ETH balance on Ethereum. Fast: only 1 RPC call.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Ethereum address (0x format). Defaults to configured wallet address.

fetchEthereumWalletAllBalances..name: fetchEthereumWalletAllBalances.
fetchEthereumWalletAllBalances..description: Get ALL supported token balances on Ethereum for a wallet (ETH, GALA, GWETH, GUSDC, GUSDT, GWTRX, GWBTC). Returns native ETH and all supported ERC-20 token balances. Note: Makes 7 RPC calls.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Ethereum address (0x format). Defaults to configured wallet address.

fetchSolanaWalletTokenBalance..name: fetchSolanaWalletTokenBalance.
fetchSolanaWalletTokenBalance..description: Get a single SPL token balance on Solana (GALA, GSOL). Fast: only 1 RPC call.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Solana address (base58 format). Defaults to configured wallet address.

fetchSolanaWalletNativeBalance..name: fetchSolanaWalletNativeBalance.
fetchSolanaWalletNativeBalance..description: Get native SOL balance on Solana. Fast: only 1 RPC call.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Solana address (base58 format). Defaults to configured wallet address.

fetchSolanaWalletAllBalances..name: fetchSolanaWalletAllBalances.
fetchSolanaWalletAllBalances..description: Get ALL supported token balances on Solana for a wallet (SOL, GALA, GSOL). Returns native SOL and all supported SPL token balances. Note: Makes 3 RPC calls.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Solana address (base58 format). Defaults to configured wallet address.

fetchBridgeableTokensByNetwork.name: fetchBridgeableTokensByNetwork
fetchBridgeableTokensByNetwork.description: Fetch bridgeable tokens for a specific network with pagination. Queries DEX API to discover which tokens can be bridged. Results are cached permanently.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response for pagination (omit for first page).

fetchAllBridgeableTokensByNetwork.name: fetchAllBridgeableTokensByNetwork
fetchAllBridgeableTokensByNetwork.description: Fetch ALL bridgeable tokens for a network with auto-pagination. Returns cached data if available. No page/limit needed.

fetchAllTokensBridgeableToEthereum.name: fetchAllTokensBridgeableToEthereum
fetchAllTokensBridgeableToEthereum.description: Fetch all tokens that can be bridged to Ethereum. Convenience method with auto-pagination and caching.

fetchAllTokensBridgeableToSolana.name: fetchAllTokensBridgeableToSolana
fetchAllTokensBridgeableToSolana.description: Fetch all tokens that can be bridged to Solana. Convenience method with auto-pagination and caching.

isTokenBridgeableToNetwork.name: isTokenBridgeableToNetwork
isTokenBridgeableToNetwork.description: Check if a token is bridgeable to a specific network. Returns bridgeability status and contract address if available.

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: Token identifier in flexible format (string or object).

isTokenBridgeableToEthereum.name: isTokenBridgeableToEthereum
isTokenBridgeableToEthereum.description: Check if a token is bridgeable to Ethereum. Returns bridgeability status and contract address if bridgeable.

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: Token identifier in flexible format (string or object).

isTokenBridgeableToSolana.name: isTokenBridgeableToSolana
isTokenBridgeableToSolana.description: Check if a token is bridgeable to Solana. Returns bridgeability status and mint address if bridgeable.

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: Token identifier in flexible format (string or object).

requestSolanaDevnetAirdrop.name: requestSolanaDevnetAirdrop
requestSolanaDevnetAirdrop.description: Request SOL airdrop from Solana devnet faucet. Only available in STAGE environment (development/testing). Maximum 2 SOL per request. Useful for funding wallets with gas fees for testing bridge operations.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount of SOL to request (default: 1, range: 0.001-2).

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Optional Solana address to receive airdrop (defaults to configured wallet).

getSolanaTransactionStatus.name: getSolanaTransactionStatus
getSolanaTransactionStatus.description: Get the status of a Solana transaction by signature. Queries Solana RPC directly using getSignatureStatuses (no WebSocket required). Use this to verify if an airdrop or bridge transaction succeeded after submission. Returns: { confirmed: boolean, status: "confirmed"|"finalized"|"processed"|"not_found"|"failed", slot?: number, error?: string }. Requires solanaPrivateKey configuration.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: Base58-encoded Solana transaction signature (87-88 characters). Get this from requestSolanaDevnetAirdrop or bridge operations.

getEthereumTransactionStatus.name: getEthereumTransactionStatus
getEthereumTransactionStatus.description: Get the status of an Ethereum transaction by hash. Queries Ethereum RPC directly using getTransactionReceipt and getTransaction (no WebSocket required). Use this to verify if a bridge transaction succeeded after submission. Returns: { confirmed: boolean, status: "pending"|"confirmed"|"finalized"|"not_found"|"failed", blockNumber?: number, confirmations?: number, gasUsed?: string, effectiveGasPrice?: string, error?: string }. Uses 12+ confirmations as finality threshold. Requires ethereumPrivateKey configuration.

parameters.name: transactionHash
parameters.description: Ethereum transaction hash (0x-prefixed 64-character hex string, 66 total characters). Get this from bridgeOut or bridgeIn operations.

fetchWrappableTokens.name: fetchWrappableTokens
fetchWrappableTokens.description: Fetch wrappable tokens with pagination. Wrappable tokens are token pairs that can be wrapped/unwrapped into each other (e.g., MUSIC â†” GMUSIC). Results are cached permanently.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response for pagination (omit for first page).

fetchAllWrappableTokens.name: fetchAllWrappableTokens
fetchAllWrappableTokens.description: Fetch ALL wrappable tokens with auto-pagination. Returns cached data if available. Wrappable tokens are token pairs that can be wrapped/unwrapped into each other (e.g., MUSIC â†” GMUSIC).

getWrappableToken.name: getWrappableToken
getWrappableToken.description: Get a wrappable token by its tokenId. Returns the token with wrap counterpart info, or undefined if not found. Uses cache for efficient lookup.

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: Token identifier in flexible format. Pipe-delimited: "$MUSIC|Unit|none|none" or TokenClassKey object: { collection, category, type, additionalKey }

getWrapCounterpart.name: getWrapCounterpart
getWrapCounterpart.description: Get the wrap counterpart for a token. For example, MUSIC â†’ GMUSIC or GMUSIC â†’ MUSIC. Returns the counterpart token or undefined if not found.

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: Token identifier in flexible format. Pipe-delimited: "$MUSIC|Unit|none|none" or TokenClassKey object: { collection, category, type, additionalKey }

isTokenWrappable.name: isTokenWrappable
isTokenWrappable.description: Check if a token is wrappable. Returns { isWrappable: boolean, tokenId, wrapCounterpart? }. Wrappable tokens can be wrapped/unwrapped into their counterpart.

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: Token identifier in flexible format. Pipe-delimited: "$MUSIC|Unit|none|none" or TokenClassKey object: { collection, category, type, additionalKey }

wrapToken.name: wrapToken
wrapToken.description: Wrap a token to its asset-channel counterpart (e.g., MUSIC â†’ GMUSIC). This is a cross-channel bridge within GalaChain, NOT an external bridge to Ethereum/Solana. Requires wallet configuration. Use for tokens that need to be wrapped before DEX trading.

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: Token identifier (accepts symbol, pipe-delimited string, or TokenClassKey object).

unwrapToken.name: unwrapToken
unwrapToken.description: Unwrap a token back to its native channel (e.g., GMUSIC â†’ MUSIC). Reverses a previous wrap operation. This is a cross-channel bridge within GalaChain, NOT an external bridge. Requires wallet configuration.

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: Token identifier (accepts symbol, pipe-delimited string, or TokenClassKey object).

estimateWrapFee.name: estimateWrapFee
estimateWrapFee.description: Estimate fees for wrapping a token to the asset channel. Wrap operations use cross_channel_authorization fee type on the source channel.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount to wrap for fee estimation.

estimateUnwrapFee.name: estimateUnwrapFee
estimateUnwrapFee.description: Estimate fees for unwrapping a token back to its native channel. Unwrap operations use automatic fee authorization on the asset channel.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount to unwrap for fee estimation.

getWrapStatus.name: getWrapStatus
getWrapStatus.description: Get the status of a wrap/unwrap transaction by transaction ID. Returns current status (pending, processing, completed, failed) and transaction details.

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: Transaction ID from wrapToken or unwrapToken operation.

startStream.name: startStream
startStream.description:
Start a live stream for a token.

Creates a new stream session and returns streaming credentials.
rtmpUrl is the RTMP server endpoint; use with streamKey in OBS or compatible software.

RETURNS: { tokenName, streamKey, rtmpUrl, playbackId, playbackUrl, status, createdAt }

Authentication: Requires wallet signature (stream creator only)

stopStream.name: stopStream
stopStream.description:
Stop a live stream for a token.

Ends the current stream session. The stream key remains valid for future streams.

RETURNS: { success: true }

Authentication: Requires wallet signature (stream creator only)

setStreamEnabled.name: setStreamEnabled
setStreamEnabled.description:
Enable or disable streaming for a specific token (Admin only).

Controls per-token streaming capability. When disabled, prevents new streams
from being started for this token. Existing active streams will continue
until they end.

RETURNS: { enabled, tokenName }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey configuration

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether streaming should be enabled for this token.

resetStreamKey.name: resetStreamKey
resetStreamKey.description:
Reset the stream key for a token.

Generates a new stream key, invalidating the previous one.
Use this if the stream key has been compromised.

RETURNS: { tokenName, streamKey, rtmpUrl, resetAt }

Authentication: Requires wallet signature (stream creator only)

setNextLiveStreamCountdown.name: setNextLiveStreamCountdown
setNextLiveStreamCountdown.description:
Set the next live stream countdown time for a token.

Schedules a future live stream for this token. The countdown can be displayed on the pool page
to let viewers know when the stream will go live.

Can be called multiple times to update the scheduled time.
Pass null as nextLiveStreamAt to clear the countdown.

RETURNS: { tokenName, nextLiveStreamAt, streamLanguage, recordingEnabled }

Authentication: Requires wallet signature (stream creator only)

parameters.name: nextLiveStreamAt
parameters.description: ISO 8601 datetime for next live stream or null to clear countdown.

getGlobalStreamingStatus.name: getGlobalStreamingStatus
getGlobalStreamingStatus.description:
Get global streaming status.

Returns platform-wide streaming status including maintenance windows.

RETURNS: { enabled, updatedAt }

Authentication: None required (public endpoint)

setGlobalStreamingEnabled.name: setGlobalStreamingEnabled
setGlobalStreamingEnabled.description:
Enable or disable streaming globally (Admin only).

Controls platform-wide streaming capability.
When disabled, no new streams can be started.

RETURNS: { enabled, updatedAt }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey configuration

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether streaming should be enabled globally.

getStreamRole.name: getStreamRole
getStreamRole.description:
Get the authenticated user's role for a token's stream with associated permissions.

Returns effective role (OWNER, MANAGER, TECHNICAL_PRODUCER, MODERATOR) with boolean permission flags.
canStream: Can start/stop streams. canModerate: Can moderate chat/ban. canManageTeam: Can manage moderator invites.

RETURNS: { role: 'OWNER'|'MANAGER'|'TECHNICAL_PRODUCER'|'MODERATOR'|null, isOwner, permissions: { canStream, canModerate, canManageTeam, canViewRecordings, canSimulcast }, source, inviteScope }

Authentication: Optional JWT - returns limited data if not authenticated

getAvailableRoles.name: getAvailableRoles
getAvailableRoles.description:
Get all available roles and permissions for token delegation.

Returns reference data about the role system, including:
- All available roles (OWNER, MANAGER, TECHNICAL_PRODUCER, MODERATOR)
- Role descriptions and hierarchy levels
- Permissions assigned to each role
- Complete list of all available permissions

**Role Hierarchy (highest to lowest):**
- OWNER (level 3): Full access to all token operations
- MANAGER (level 2): Full moderator + tech producer + recordings + settings
- TECHNICAL_PRODUCER (level 1): Stream setup and management
- MODERATOR (level 0): Community and chat management

**Available Permissions:**
- MANAGE_COMMENTS: Create/delete comments
- MANAGE_CHAT: Send/delete chat messages
- BAN_USERS: Ban users from token streams
- UNBAN_USERS: Remove bans from users
- MANAGE_SIMULCAST: Add/remove simulcast targets
- GET_STREAM_KEY: View the stream key
- STOP_STREAM: Stop an active stream
- RESET_STREAM_KEY: Generate a new stream key
- START_STREAM: Start a new stream
- DELETE_RECORDINGS: Delete stream recordings
- MANAGE_STREAM_SETTINGS: Update stream settings (countdown, language)

This is static reference data - it doesn't change per user or token.
Useful for building role selection UIs and understanding permission hierarchies.

RETURNS: { roles: [...], permissions: [...] }

Authentication: None required (public endpoint)

getTokenAccess.name: getTokenAccess
getTokenAccess.description:
Check if the authenticated user has Studio access for a token.

Returns comprehensive access information combining:
1. Token ownership check (OWNER role)
2. Claimed moderator invite (MANAGER, TECHNICAL_PRODUCER, MODERATOR)
3. Platform overseer status (global access)

This is used by frontends to determine whether to show "Click to Studio" links.

**Access Sources:**
- ownership: User is the token owner (OWNER role)
- moderator_invite: User has a claimed moderator invite
- overseer: User has platform-wide overseer access

**Permissions Returned:**
- canStream: Can start/stop streams
- canModerate: Can moderate chat and ban users
- canManageTeam: Can manage moderator invites
- canViewRecordings: Can view and download recordings
- canSimulcast: Can manage simulcast targets
- canViewAnalytics: Can view stream analytics

RETURNS: {
  hasAccess: boolean,
  role: 'OWNER' | 'MANAGER' | 'TECHNICAL_PRODUCER' | 'MODERATOR' | 'OVERSEER' | null,
  permissions: { canStream, canModerate, canManageTeam, canViewRecordings, canSimulcast, canViewAnalytics },
  accessSource: 'ownership' | 'moderator_invite' | 'overseer' | null,
  inviteScope?: 'TOKEN' | 'ALL_OWNER_TOKENS' | null,
  isOwner: boolean,
  isOverseer: boolean
}

Authentication: Optional JWT - returns limited data if not authenticated

getStreamRecordings.name: getStreamRecordings
getStreamRecordings.description:
Get recordings for a stream.

Returns paginated list of available recordings from past streams using cursor-based pagination.

RETURNS: { recordings: [...], tokenName, pageInfo: { hasNextPage, endCursor, hasPreviousPage, startCursor } }

Authentication: None required (public endpoint)

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

getRecordingDownload.name: getRecordingDownload
getRecordingDownload.description:
Get a signed download URL for a recording.

Returns a time-limited URL for downloading the recording file.

RETURNS: { downloadUrl, expiresAt, assetId, fileName }

Authentication: Requires wallet signature (stream creator only)

deleteRecording.name: deleteRecording
deleteRecording.description:
Delete a stream recording.

Permanently removes the recording. This action cannot be undone.

RETURNS: { success: true }

Authentication: Requires wallet signature (stream creator only)

getSimulcastTargets.name: getSimulcastTargets
getSimulcastTargets.description:
Get simulcast targets for a stream.

Returns list of configured simulcast destinations with platform, rtmpUrl, and status for each target.

RETURNS: { targets: [{ targetId, platform, rtmpUrl, status, name, createdAt }, ...], tokenName, maxTargets }

Authentication: None required (public endpoint)

addSimulcastTarget.name: addSimulcastTarget
addSimulcastTarget.description:
Add a simulcast target to a stream.

Configure the stream to rebroadcast to an external platform like YouTube, Twitch, or Facebook.

RETURNS: { target: { targetId, platform, rtmpUrl, status, name, createdAt }, tokenName }

Authentication: Requires wallet signature (stream creator only)

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: Simulcast platform (YOUTUBE, TWITCH, FACEBOOK, or CUSTOM).

parameters.name: streamKey
parameters.description: Stream key for the simulcast target.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Optional display name for the simulcast target.

removeSimulcastTarget.name: removeSimulcastTarget
removeSimulcastTarget.description:
Remove a simulcast target from a stream.

Stops rebroadcasting to the specified platform.

RETURNS: { success: true }

Authentication: Requires wallet signature (stream creator only)

getChatStatus.name: getChatStatus
getChatStatus.description:
Get chat status for a stream.

Returns whether chat is enabled and the detailed status for the stream.

**Status Values:**
- ENABLED: Chat is on (default)
- DISABLED: Owner disabled (owner can re-enable)
- ADMIN_DISABLED: Admin disabled (owner locked out)

RETURNS: { enabled, status, reason? }

Authentication: None required (public endpoint)

setChatEnabled.name: setChatEnabled
setChatEnabled.description:
Enable or disable chat for a specific token.

Dual-auth endpoint - supports both Admin API key and JWT (owner) auth.

**Authorization:**
- Admin (API key): Sets ADMIN_DISABLED when disabling - owner is locked out
- Owner (JWT): Sets DISABLED when disabling - owner can re-enable later

When ADMIN_DISABLED, only an admin can enable chat.
Owners attempting to enable when ADMIN_DISABLED will get a 403 error.

RETURNS: { enabled, tokenName, status }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth (token owner)

getGlobalChatStatus.name: getGlobalChatStatus
getGlobalChatStatus.description:
Get global chat status.

Returns platform-wide chat status.

RETURNS: { enabled, updatedAt }

Authentication: None required (public endpoint)

setGlobalChatEnabled.name: setGlobalChatEnabled
setGlobalChatEnabled.description:
Enable or disable chat globally (Admin only).

Controls platform-wide chat capability.
When disabled, no chat messages can be sent.

RETURNS: { enabled, updatedAt }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey configuration

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether chat should be enabled globally.

getEngagementStats.name: getEngagementStats
getEngagementStats.description:
Get engagement statistics for a token.

Returns aggregated engagement metrics including:
- Chat: message count, unique chatters, session start time
- Comments: total count, unique commenters

Chat stats are scoped to the current/last stream session.
Comment stats are all-time for the token.

RETURNS: {
  tokenName: string,
  chat: { messageCount: number, uniqueChatters: number, since: string | null },
  comments: { count: number, uniqueCommenters: number }
}

connectStreamWebsocket.name: connectStreamWebsocket
connectStreamWebsocket.description:
Connect to the stream WebSocket server.

Establishes a WebSocket connection for real-time stream events.
Must be called before subscribing to streams or sending WebSocket chat.

Throws error if connection fails or if already connected. Check SDK state before calling.
This connection persists until explicitly disconnected or the SDK is cleaned up.
Use gala_launchpad_disconnect_stream_websocket to close the connection.

RETURNS: { connected: true, message: 'Connected to stream WebSocket' }

Authentication: None required for connection (authentication needed for some operations).

subscribeToStream.name: subscribeToStream
subscribeToStream.description:
Subscribe to a stream's real-time events.

Must be connected via gala_launchpad_connect_stream_websocket first - throws error if not connected.
After subscribing, you will receive these events:
- stream_status: Live/offline status changes
- viewer_count: Real-time viewer count updates
- chat_message: New chat messages
- chat_status: Chat enable/disable events

RETURNS: { tokenName, status, playbackId, isLive, subscribedAt }

sendStreamChatViaWebSocket.name: sendStreamChatViaWebSocket
sendStreamChatViaWebSocket.description:
Send a chat message via WebSocket.

Sends a message through the WebSocket connection (lower latency than REST).
Requires:
1. WebSocket connected via gala_launchpad_connect_stream_websocket
2. Authenticated via wallet signature
3. Subscribed to the stream via gala_launchpad_subscribe_to_stream

RETURNS: { sent: true, tokenName, content }

Authentication: Requires wallet signature via WebSocket authentication.

sendStreamReaction.name: sendStreamReaction
sendStreamReaction.description:
Send an ephemeral emoji reaction to a live stream.

Reactions are broadcast to all viewers via WebSocket but NOT persisted to database.
Rate limiting is enforced server-side (burst of 10, then 0.5/sec refill).

Requires:
1. WebSocket connected via gala_launchpad_connect_stream_websocket
2. Authenticated via wallet signature
3. Subscribed to the stream via gala_launchpad_subscribe_to_stream

RETURNS: { sent: true, tokenName, emoji, streamTime }

Authentication: Requires wallet signature via WebSocket authentication.

parameters.name: emoji
parameters.description: Emoji to send (single emoji or short sequence, max 15 chars). Preset: heart, fire, rocket, gem, star.

parameters.name: streamTime
parameters.description: Current stream timecode in seconds (for viewer sync, defaults to 0).

sendTypingIndicator.name: sendTypingIndicator
sendTypingIndicator.description:
Send a typing indicator to a stream chat.

Indicates whether the authenticated user is currently typing.
Typing indicators are ephemeral (NOT persisted to database) and broadcast to all
users in the stream chat room except the sender.

The server auto-clears typing status after 5 seconds of inactivity.
Other users will see "X is typing...", "X and Y are typing...", or "Several people are typing...".

Requires:
1. WebSocket connected via gala_launchpad_connect_stream_websocket
2. Authenticated via wallet signature
3. Subscribed to the stream via gala_launchpad_subscribe_to_stream

RETURNS: { sent: true, tokenName, isTyping }

Authentication: Requires wallet signature via WebSocket authentication.

parameters.name: isTyping
parameters.description: Whether the user is currently typing (true = start typing, false = stop typing).

login.name: login
login.description: Authenticate with wallet signature to get JWT token. Required before using protected features (streaming, chat, uploads). Returns accessToken and expiresIn seconds.

logout.name: logout
logout.description: Clear JWT token and end session. Future protected operations will fail until login() is called again.

refreshToken.name: refreshToken
refreshToken.description: Refresh JWT token before it expires. Use shouldRefreshToken() to check if refresh is needed. Returns new accessToken and expiresIn.

getSession.name: getSession
getSession.description: Get current session information from backend. Returns authenticated address and token timestamps. Requires active session.

isAuthenticated.name: isAuthenticated
isAuthenticated.description: Check if user is authenticated with valid (non-expired) JWT token. Returns boolean.

shouldRefreshToken.name: shouldRefreshToken
shouldRefreshToken.description: Check if JWT token should be refreshed (expires within threshold). Default threshold is 5 minutes. Returns boolean.

getAccessToken.name: getAccessToken
getAccessToken.description: Get the raw JWT access token string for custom requests. Returns null if not authenticated.

ensureValidToken.name: ensureValidToken
ensureValidToken.description: Ensure valid token exists, refreshing if necessary. Call before long operations. Throws if not authenticated.

createBan.name: createBan
createBan.description:
Create a ban for a user on a token.

Bans prevent users from sending chat messages and reactions on the specified token's stream.
Can be permanent (omit durationSeconds) or temporary (specify duration).

**Duration Presets:**
- 1 hour: 3600
- 1 day: 86400
- 1 week: 604800
- 1 month: 2592000

RETURNS: { ban: { id, userAddress, tokenName, reason, bannedBy, expiresAt, createdAt, isPermanent }, tokenName }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth (token owner).

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: Wallet address of user to ban.

parameters.name: durationSeconds
parameters.description: Ban duration in seconds (optional, omit for permanent). Range: 60 (1 min) to 31536000 (1 year). Presets: 3600 (1 hour), 86400 (1 day), 604800 (1 week), 2592000 (1 month).

removeBan.name: removeBan
removeBan.description:
Remove a ban for a user on a token.

Unbans the user, allowing them to send chat messages and reactions again.

RETURNS: { removed: true, tokenName, userAddress }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth (token owner).

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: Wallet address of user to unban.

listBans.name: listBans
listBans.description:
List all banned users for a token.

Returns a paginated list of banned users with their ban details using cursor-based pagination.
Supports filtering by search query, name, or user address.

**Filter Behavior:**
- search: Combined search on userAddress OR fullName (partial match)
- name: Filter by fullName only
- userAddress: Filter by userAddress only

RETURNS: { bans: [...], pageInfo: { hasNextPage, endCursor, hasPreviousPage, startCursor } }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth (token owner).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by fullName only (case-insensitive, partial match).

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: Filter by userAddress only (case-insensitive, partial match).

getBanStatus.name: getBanStatus
getBanStatus.description:
Check if a specific user is banned on a token.

Returns whether the user is currently banned and ban details if applicable.

RETURNS: { banned: boolean, ban?: { ... }, tokenName, userAddress }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth (token owner).

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: Wallet address of user to check.

getActiveUsers.name: getActiveUsers
getActiveUsers.description:
Get currently active users on a token's stream.

Returns up to 1000 active viewers or chat participants.
Useful for moderation - see who's watching/chatting before issuing bans.

**User Types:**
- viewers: All users currently connected to the stream
- chat_participants: Users who have sent chat messages

RETURNS: { tokenName, type, users: [...], total, truncated }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth (token owner).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of active users to fetch (default: viewers).

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by fullName only (case-insensitive, partial match).

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: Filter by userAddress only (case-insensitive, partial match).

onBanEnforcement.name: onBanEnforcement
onBanEnforcement.description:
Watch for user ban enforcement events in real-time.

Triggers when users are banned, unbanned, or ban enforcement actions are taken. Includes:
- USER_BANNED: User restricted from platform due to policy violation
- USER_UNBANNED: Ban lifted, user access restored
- BAN_ENFORCEMENT: Enforcement action taken (message deletion, chat suspension, etc.)

Returns:
- banActionsEnforced: Number of ban enforcement events detected
- events: Array of ban events with userAddress, actionType, reason, tokenName, and timestamp

Filter Options:
- userAddress: Only watch bans for a specific user
- actionType: Filter by action type ('BANNED', 'UNBANNED', or 'ENFORCEMENT')
- tokenName: Only watch bans related to a specific token
- reason: Filter by ban reason or violation type.

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: Only watch bans for this user (optional).

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Filter bans for a specific token (optional).

parameters.name: durationSeconds
parameters.description: How long to watch for new events in seconds (default: 60).

createApiKey.name: createApiKey
createApiKey.description:
Create a new API key for delegating permissions.

**CRITICAL**: The rawKey in the response is ONLY shown once!
Store it securely immediately - it cannot be retrieved again.

**Roles (hierarchical):**
- MODERATOR: Manage comments, chat, bans
- TECHNICAL_PRODUCER: Stream control, simulcast
- MANAGER: Moderator + Technical Producer + recordings
- OWNER: Full access

**Token Delegation:**
- delegateAllTokens=true: Access to all current and future tokens
- delegateAllTokens=false + tokenNames: Access to specific tokens only

RETURNS: { id, keyPrefix, rawKey, description, role, delegateAllTokens, tokenNames, expiresAt, createdAt, ... }

Authentication: Requires JWT auth (call sdk.login() first).

parameters.name: role
parameters.description:
API key role determining permissions:
- MODERATOR: Manage comments, chat messages, ban/unban users
- TECHNICAL_PRODUCER: Simulcast targets, stream key, stop/start stream
- MANAGER: Moderator + Technical Producer + recordings + stream settings
- OWNER: Full access (indistinguishable from normal auth).

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: User's description/label for this API key (max 255 characters)

parameters.name: delegateAllTokens
parameters.description: If true, key has access to ALL tokens owned by the user (current and future). If false, only tokens in tokenNames are accessible.

parameters.name: tokenNames
parameters.description: Specific tokens to delegate access to (ignored if delegateAllTokens is true). Token names are case-insensitive.

parameters.name: expiresAt
parameters.description: Optional expiration date in ISO 8601 format (e.g., "2025-12-31T23:59:59Z"). If not provided, never expires.

listApiKeys.name: listApiKeys
listApiKeys.description:
List all API keys for the authenticated user.

Returns a paginated list of API keys using cursor-based pagination.
Raw keys are never included - they are only shown once at creation time.

RETURNS: { apiKeys: [...], pageInfo: { hasNextPage, endCursor, hasPreviousPage, startCursor } }

Authentication: Requires JWT auth (call sdk.login() first).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

getApiKey.name: getApiKey
getApiKey.description:
Get a single API key by ID.

Returns the API key metadata. Raw key is never included.

RETURNS: { id, keyPrefix, description, role, delegateAllTokens, tokenNames, expiresAt, lastUsedAt, createdAt, updatedAt }

Authentication: Requires JWT auth (call sdk.login() first).

updateApiKey.name: updateApiKey
updateApiKey.description:
Update an API key's metadata and permissions.

Cannot change the key itself, only metadata and permissions.
At least one field must be provided.

**Updatable fields:**
- role: Change permission level
- description: Update label/description
- delegateAllTokens: Toggle all-token access
- tokenNames: Update specific token delegations (replaces existing)
- expiresAt: Update expiration (null to remove)

RETURNS: { id, keyPrefix, description, role, delegateAllTokens, tokenNames, expiresAt, lastUsedAt, createdAt, updatedAt }

Authentication: Requires JWT auth (call sdk.login() first).

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: New role for the API key (optional)

parameters.name: expiresAt
parameters.description: Updated expiration date in ISO 8601 format. Pass null to remove expiration (optional).

revokeApiKey.name: revokeApiKey
revokeApiKey.description:
Revoke an API key.

This performs a soft delete - the key becomes immediately unusable
but is retained for audit purposes.

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "API key revoked" }

Authentication: Requires JWT auth (call sdk.login() first).

getApiKeyRoles.name: getApiKeyRoles
getApiKeyRoles.description:
Get all valid API key roles.

Returns the list of available roles for API keys.
Useful for understanding the permission hierarchy.

**Roles (hierarchical):**
- MODERATOR: Manage comments, chat messages, ban/unban users
- TECHNICAL_PRODUCER: Simulcast targets, stream key, stop/start stream
- MANAGER: Moderator + Technical Producer + recordings + stream settings
- OWNER: Full access (indistinguishable from normal auth)

RETURNS: { roles: ["MODERATOR", "TECHNICAL_PRODUCER", "MANAGER", "OWNER"] }

Authentication: None required (utility method).

createModeratorInvite.name: createModeratorInvite
createModeratorInvite.description:
Create a moderator invite for a token or all tokens.

Creates a magic link invite that can be shared to grant moderator access.
The recipient claims the invite after logging in.

**Invite Scopes:**
- TOKEN (default): Access to a specific token only. tokenName is required.
- ALL_OWNER_TOKENS: Blanket access to ALL tokens owned by the inviter.
  The moderator gains access to current AND future tokens. Omit tokenName.

**Roles:**
- MODERATOR: Manage comments, chat, bans
- TECHNICAL_PRODUCER: Stream control, simulcast, stream key
- MANAGER: All of the above + recordings + stream settings

**Note:** OWNER role is not available for invites.

RETURNS: { invite: { id, inviteScope, tokenName, role, inviteCode, inviteUrl, description, status, expiresAt, createdAt } }

Authentication: Requires JWT auth as token owner.

parameters.name: inviteScope
parameters.description:
Invite scope (default: TOKEN):
- TOKEN: Access to a specific token only (tokenName required)
- ALL_OWNER_TOKENS: Blanket access to ALL tokens owned by the inviter (tokenName should be omitted).

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name (required for TOKEN scope, omit for ALL_OWNER_TOKENS)

parameters.name: role
parameters.description:
Role to grant:
- MODERATOR: Manage comments, chat messages, ban/unban users
- TECHNICAL_PRODUCER: Simulcast targets, stream key, stop/start stream
- MANAGER: All of the above + recordings + stream settings.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Optional description/label for the invite (e.g., "John - Friday shows"). Max 255 characters.

parameters.name: expiresAt
parameters.description: Optional expiration date in ISO 8601 format (e.g., "2025-12-31T23:59:59Z"). If not provided, never expires.

claimModeratorInvite.name: claimModeratorInvite
claimModeratorInvite.description:
Claim a moderator invite.

Claims an invite using the code from a magic link URL. The authenticated
user's wallet becomes the moderator with the granted role.

**Requirements:**
- Invite must be in PENDING status
- Invite must not be expired

**Returns based on invite scope:**
- TOKEN scope: { token: { tokenName, tokenSymbol, role, inviteScope, ... } }
- ALL_OWNER_TOKENS scope: { blanketAccess: { inviteScope, role, claimedAt } }

Authentication: Requires JWT auth.

parameters.name: inviteCode
parameters.description: The 64-character hex invite code from the magic link URL.

getModeratedTokens.name: getModeratedTokens
getModeratedTokens.description:
Get all tokens the current user moderates.

Returns a paginated list of tokens where the authenticated user has claimed
a moderator invite and has active access using cursor-based pagination.
Used for the /studio dashboard.

RETURNS: { tokens: [...], pageInfo: { hasNextPage, endCursor, hasPreviousPage, startCursor } }

Authentication: Requires JWT auth.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

listModeratorInvites.name: listModeratorInvites
listModeratorInvites.description:
List moderator invites.

Returns a paginated list of moderator invites using cursor-based pagination.
Behavior depends on tokenName:
- With tokenName: Returns invites for that specific token (verifies ownership)
- Without tokenName: Returns ALL invites created by the authenticated user across all tokens

RETURNS: { invites: [...], pageInfo: { hasNextPage, endCursor, hasPreviousPage, startCursor } }

Authentication: Requires JWT auth.

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name to filter by (optional - omit to list ALL invites across all tokens)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Filter invites by status:
- PENDING: Not yet claimed
- CLAIMED: Claimed by a moderator
- REVOKED: Revoked by the owner
- EXPIRED: Past expiration date.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

revokeModeratorInvite.name: revokeModeratorInvite
revokeModeratorInvite.description:
Revoke a moderator invite.

Revokes an invite by ID, preventing it from being claimed. If already claimed,
the moderator loses access to the token.

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Invite revoked" }

Authentication: Requires JWT auth as token owner.

updateModeratorInviteRole.name: updateModeratorInviteRole
updateModeratorInviteRole.description:
Update the role of a moderator invite.

Changes the role granted by the invite. For claimed invites, the moderator's
effective permissions change immediately (enforced at runtime).

**Roles:**
- MODERATOR: Manage comments, chat, bans
- TECHNICAL_PRODUCER: Stream control, simulcast, stream key
- MANAGER: All of the above + recordings + stream settings

**Note:** OWNER role is not available for invites.

RETURNS: { invite: { id, inviteScope, tokenName, role, inviteCode, inviteUrl, description, status, expiresAt, createdAt } }

Authentication: Requires JWT auth as token owner.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description:
Role to grant:
- MODERATOR: Manage comments, chat messages, ban/unban users
- TECHNICAL_PRODUCER: Simulcast targets, stream key, stop/start stream
- MANAGER: All of the above + recordings + stream settings.

getModeratorInvite.name: getModeratorInvite
getModeratorInvite.description:
Get invite details by code (public endpoint).

Returns public information about an invite for the claim page. This is used
by the frontend to display invite details before the user logs in to claim.

**Returned info:**
- Token name, symbol, image
- Role to be granted
- Invite status and expiration
- Who created the invite

RETURNS: { tokenName, tokenSymbol, tokenImage, role, description, status, expiresAt, invitedBy: { address, fullName } }

Authentication: None required (public endpoint).

parameters.name: inviteCode
parameters.description: The 64-character hex invite code from the magic link URL.

onModeratorChanged.name: onModeratorChanged
onModeratorChanged.description:
Watch for moderator management events in real-time.

Triggers when moderators are added, removed, or their roles are updated. Includes:
- MODERATOR_ADDED: New moderator invitation accepted
- MODERATOR_REMOVED: Moderator permissions revoked
- MODERATOR_ROLE_UPDATED: Permission level changed (e.g., to MANAGER)

Returns:
- moderatorsChanged: Number of moderator change events detected
- events: Array of moderator events with tokenName, moderatorAddress, eventType, and role information

Filter Options:
- tokenName: Only watch changes for a specific token
- eventType: Filter by event type ('ADDED', 'REMOVED', or 'ROLE_UPDATED')
- moderatorAddress: Only watch changes for a specific moderator.

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Only watch changes for this token (optional).

parameters.name: moderatorAddress
parameters.description: Only watch changes for this moderator (optional).

parameters.name: durationSeconds
parameters.description: How long to watch for new events in seconds (default: 60).

getActiveModerators.name: getActiveModerators
getActiveModerators.description:
Get list of active moderators for a specific token.

Returns all moderators currently assigned to a token, including their:
- Address / identifier
- Role level (MODERATOR, TECHNICAL_PRODUCER, MANAGER, OWNER)
- Permissions (can manage chat, ban users, etc.)
- Join date
- Status (active, pending invitation, or inactive)

Useful for understanding chat management team, permissions analysis, and access control verification.

Returns: Array of moderator objects with address, role, permissions, and status.

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: The token name to get moderators for.

createFlag.name: createFlag
createFlag.description:
Create a content flag/report.

Two-tier system:
- Chat/Comment: reason and details are optional (one-click flag)
- Stream: reason is REQUIRED (modal flow)

Use this when a user reports inappropriate content.

RETURNS: { flag: { id, tokenName, contentType, contentId, reporterAddress, reportedUserAddress, reason, details, status, createdAt } }

Authentication: Requires JWT auth (logged-in user session).

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
Type of content being flagged:
- CHAT_MESSAGE: A chat message in the stream
- COMMENT: A comment on the token page
- STREAM: The live stream itself

parameters.name: contentId
parameters.description: ID of the content being flagged (message ID, comment ID, or stream ID).

parameters.name: reportedUserAddress
parameters.description: Wallet address of the user who created the flagged content.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description:
Reason for the flag (required for STREAM, optional for others):
- INAPPROPRIATE_CONTENT: Explicit, offensive, or unsuitable content
- SPAM: Unsolicited promotional or repetitive content
- HARASSMENT: Bullying, threats, or targeted attacks
- SCAM: Fraudulent or deceptive content
- OTHER: Other reason (specify in details)

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Additional details about the flag (optional, max 500 characters).

listFlags.name: listFlags
listFlags.description:
List flags for a specific token with pagination and filtering.

Authorization varies by content type:
- CHAT_MESSAGE/COMMENT: Token owner or moderator (JWT) can view
- STREAM: Admin API key only

Use to review pending flags for a specific token.
For global flags across all tokens, use gala_launchpad_list_global_flags.

RETURNS: { flags: [...], pageInfo: { hasNextPage, endCursor, hasPreviousPage, startCursor } }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth (token owner/moderator).

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Filter by flag status:
- PENDING: Not yet reviewed
- DISMISSED: Reviewed, no action taken
- ACTIONED: Reviewed, action was taken

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

listGlobalFlags.name: listGlobalFlags
listGlobalFlags.description:
List ALL flags globally across all tokens with pagination and filtering.

For overseers and admins to view flags across the entire platform.
Use listFlags() for token-specific flag lists.

Filter options:
- tokenName: Filter to a specific token
- contentType: Filter by CHAT_MESSAGE, COMMENT, or STREAM
- status: Filter by PENDING, DISMISSED, or ACTIONED
- reason: Filter by flag reason (SPAM, HARASSMENT, etc.)
- reporterAddress: Filter by who submitted the flag
