- reportedUserAddress: Filter by the content author

RETURNS: { flags: [...], pageInfo: { hasNextPage, endCursor, hasPreviousPage, startCursor } }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth (overseer).

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Filter by token name (optional - omit to show all tokens)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Filter by flag status:
- PENDING: Not yet reviewed
- DISMISSED: Reviewed, no action taken
- ACTIONED: Reviewed, action was taken

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

dismissFlag.name: dismissFlag
dismissFlag.description:
Dismiss a flag (no action taken).

Marks the flag as reviewed but takes no action on the content.
Use when the flag is invalid, unfounded, or doesn't warrant action.

RETURNS: { flag: { id, status: 'DISMISSED', reviewedBy, reviewedAt, ... } }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth (token owner/moderator).

actionFlag.name: actionFlag
actionFlag.description:
Take action on a flag.

Actions available:
- DELETE_CONTENT: Remove the flagged content
- BAN_USER: Ban the reported user from the token
- DELETE_AND_BAN: Both delete content and ban user

Use when the flag is valid and requires action.

RETURNS: { flag: { id, status: 'ACTIONED', actionTaken, reviewedBy, reviewedAt, ... } }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth (token owner/moderator).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
Action to take on the flagged content:
- DELETE_CONTENT: Remove the flagged content only
- BAN_USER: Ban the reported user from the token
- DELETE_AND_BAN: Delete content AND ban user

createOverseerInvite.name: createOverseerInvite
createOverseerInvite.description:
Create an overseer invite.

Overseers have GLOBAL platform access with MANAGER-level permissions across ALL tokens
(current and future). This is different from moderators who have token-scoped access.

Creates a magic link invite that can be shared to grant overseer access.
The recipient claims the invite after logging in.

RETURNS: { invite: { id, inviteCode, inviteUrl, invitedBy, claimedBy, description, status, expiresAt, createdAt } }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as existing Overseer.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Optional description/label for the invite (e.g., "John - Platform Team"). Max 255 characters.

parameters.name: expiresAt
parameters.description: Optional expiration date in ISO 8601 format (e.g., "2025-12-31T23:59:59Z"). If not provided, never expires.

listOverseerInvites.name: listOverseerInvites
listOverseerInvites.description:
List all overseer invites with cursor-based pagination and filtering.

Returns a paginated list of overseer invites that can be filtered by status.

RETURNS: { invites: [...], pageInfo: { hasNextPage, endCursor, hasPreviousPage, startCursor } }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as existing Overseer.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Filter invites by status:
- PENDING: Not yet claimed
- CLAIMED: Claimed by an overseer
- REVOKED: Revoked by admin/overseer
- EXPIRED: Past expiration date.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

getOverseerInvite.name: getOverseerInvite
getOverseerInvite.description:
Get overseer invite details by code (public endpoint).

Returns public information about an invite for the claim page. This is used
by the frontend to display invite details before the user logs in to claim.

**Returned info:**
- Description (if set)
- Invite status and expiration
- Who created the invite

RETURNS: { description, status, expiresAt, invitedBy: { address, fullName } }

Authentication: None required (public endpoint).

parameters.name: inviteCode
parameters.description: The invite code from the magic link URL.

claimOverseerInvite.name: claimOverseerInvite
claimOverseerInvite.description:
Claim an overseer invite.

Claims an invite using the code from a magic link URL. The authenticated
user's wallet becomes an overseer with GLOBAL access to ALL tokens on the platform.

**Requirements:**
- Invite must be in PENDING status
- Invite must not be expired

RETURNS: { invite: { id, inviteCode, inviteUrl, invitedBy, claimedBy, description, status, expiresAt, claimedAt, createdAt } }

Authentication: Requires JWT auth.

parameters.name: inviteCode
parameters.description: The invite code from the magic link URL.

revokeOverseerInvite.name: revokeOverseerInvite
revokeOverseerInvite.description:
Revoke an overseer invite.

Revokes an invite by ID, preventing it from being claimed. If already claimed,
the overseer loses access to the platform.

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Invite revoked" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as existing Overseer.

listOverseers.name: listOverseers
listOverseers.description:
List all overseers with cursor-based pagination and filtering.

Returns a paginated list of overseers that can be filtered by status.

RETURNS: { overseers: [...], pageInfo: { hasNextPage, endCursor, hasPreviousPage, startCursor } }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as existing Overseer.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Filter overseers by status:
- ACTIVE: Currently active overseer
- REVOKED: Access has been revoked.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

createOverseerDirect.name: createOverseerDirect
createOverseerDirect.description:
Create an overseer directly (bypassing invite flow).

Directly promotes a user to overseer status without requiring them to claim an invite.
A synthetic invite record is created for audit trail.

Use this when you need to promote someone programmatically without requiring their
interaction (e.g., CLI admin tools, automated tests).

RETURNS: { overseer: { id, userAddress, inviteId, status, createdAt } }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as existing Overseer.

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: Wallet address to promote to overseer (eth|... or 0x... format).

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Optional description/label for the invite (e.g., "John - Platform Team"). Max 255 characters.

revokeOverseer.name: revokeOverseer
revokeOverseer.description:
Revoke an overseer's access.

Revokes an overseer by wallet address, removing their global platform access.

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Overseer access revoked" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as existing Overseer.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Wallet address of the overseer to revoke (eth|... or 0x... format).

getMyOverseerStatus.name: getMyOverseerStatus
getMyOverseerStatus.description:
Check your own overseer status.

Returns whether the authenticated user is currently an active overseer
and their details if so.

RETURNS: { isOverseer: boolean, overseer?: { id, userAddress, inviteId, status, createdAt } }

Authentication: Requires JWT auth.

getOverseerSummary.name: getOverseerSummary
getOverseerSummary.description:
Get platform summary for CCTV dashboard.

Returns quick counts for the overseer monitoring dashboard:
- Active streams (pools with live streams)
- Total viewers across all active streams
- Pending content flags awaiting review
- Total pools on the platform

Use this for dashboard header stats. For detailed data, use:
- gala_launchpad_fetch_pools (filter by muxStreamStatus=ACTIVE) for stream list
- gala_launchpad_get_global_flags (status=PENDING) for pending flags

RETURNS: { activeStreams, totalViewers, pendingFlags, totalPools }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer.

listOverseerUsers.name: listOverseerUsers
listOverseerUsers.description:
List users with pagination and sorting (Overseer/Admin only).

Retrieves a paginated list of users across the platform with optional filtering and sorting.
Useful for overseer/admin dashboard user management.

**Sort Options:**
- address: User wallet address
- flagsReceived: Content flags received
- activeBans: Active bans count
- createdAt: Account creation date (default)

RETURNS: { items: [...], total: number, cursor?, pageSize }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as existing Overseer.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search by user address or name.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response for pagination (omit for first page).

getOverseerUserSummary.name: getOverseerUserSummary
getOverseerUserSummary.description:
Get comprehensive user summary (Admin/Overseer only).

Retrieves full profile, activity metrics, ban status, and other detailed information
for a specific user. Perfect for overseer dashboard user detail pages.

RETURNS: { address, profile: { name, image, bio }, statistics: { tokens, positions, trades }, metrics: { flagsReceived, activeBans }, createdAt }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as existing Overseer.

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: User wallet address to get summary for.

flushCacheByAddress.name: flushCacheByAddress
flushCacheByAddress.description:
Flush all cache entries for a wallet address.

Clears all cached data associated with the specified address including:
- User profile data (profile:data:*, profile:stats:*)
- Overseer status
- Owned tokens list
- Ban status (global and per-token)
- Moderator access entries

Use this when:
- User data appears stale or incorrect
- After debugging user-specific issues
- Resolving profile display inconsistencies

RETURNS: { flushedCount, duration, target }
- flushedCount: Number of cache keys flushed
- duration: Time taken in milliseconds
- target: Normalized address that was flushed

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as existing Overseer.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Wallet address to flush cache for (eth|... or 0x... format).

flushCacheByToken.name: flushCacheByToken
flushCacheByToken.description:
Flush all cache entries for a token.

Clears all cached data associated with the specified token including:
- Stream chat messages and pinned messages
- Recordings list
- Holders data and rankings
- Token ban status
- Price data (GALA and USD)
- Vault address mapping

Use this when:
- Token data appears stale or incorrect
- Chat/stream data seems outdated
- Price or holder data is inconsistent
- After modifying token settings

RETURNS: { flushedCount, duration, target }
- flushedCount: Number of cache keys flushed
- duration: Time taken in milliseconds
- target: Normalized token name that was flushed

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as existing Overseer.

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name to flush cache for (case-insensitive).

flushAllCache.name: flushAllCache
flushAllCache.description:
âš ï¸ NUCLEAR OPTION: Flush ALL Launchpad cache.

Clears ALL cached data across the entire Launchpad platform. This includes:
- All user profile data
- All token data (chat, recordings, holders, prices)
- All overseer/moderator access data
- All ban status data
- Site configuration cache
- Everything else

**WARNING:** This will cause a temporary performance hit as all data
needs to be re-fetched from the database. Use only when absolutely necessary.

**Safety Feature:** Requires confirm=true to prevent accidental usage.

Use this when:
- Major cache corruption suspected
- After database migrations
- Debugging platform-wide issues
- Testing cache behavior

RETURNS: { flushedCount, duration }
- flushedCount: Total number of cache keys flushed
- duration: Time taken in milliseconds

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as existing Overseer.

parameters.name: confirm
parameters.description: Safety confirmation flag - MUST be true to proceed with flush all cache. This is the nuclear option!

banToken.name: banToken
banToken.description:
Ban a token from the platform (overseer only).

When a token is banned:
- Hidden from ALL pool listings (including creator's profile)
- Comments blocked on banned tokens
- Live streaming blocked on banned tokens
- Chat messages blocked on banned tokens
- Trading NOT blocked (GalaChain handles trading independently)

Token bans are permanent until explicitly removed by an overseer.

RETURNS: { ban: { id, tokenName, reason, bannedBy, createdAt, updatedAt }, tokenName }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth with overseer status.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Ban reason (optional, max 500 characters). E.g., "Fraudulent project", "Scam token", etc.

unbanToken.name: unbanToken
unbanToken.description:
Remove a ban from a token (overseer only).

When a token is unbanned:
- Restored to all pool listings
- Visible on creator's profile again
- Comments re-enabled
- Live streaming re-enabled
- Chat re-enabled

RETURNS: { removed: true, tokenName }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth with overseer status.

listTokenBans.name: listTokenBans
listTokenBans.description:
List all banned tokens (overseer only).

Returns a paginated list of all banned tokens with their ban details using cursor-based pagination.
Supports searching by token name (partial match).

RETURNS: { items: [{ id, tokenName, reason, bannedBy, createdAt, updatedAt }...], pageInfo: { hasNextPage, endCursor, hasPreviousPage, startCursor } }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth with overseer status.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search by token name (partial match, case-insensitive).

getTokenBan.name: getTokenBan
getTokenBan.description:
Get ban details for a specific token (overseer only).

Returns whether the token is banned and ban details if applicable.
Use this for detailed ban information including reason and who banned it.

RETURNS: { banned: boolean, ban?: { id, tokenName, reason, bannedBy, createdAt, updatedAt }, tokenName }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth with overseer status.

isTokenBanned.name: isTokenBanned
isTokenBanned.description:
Check if a token is banned (overseer only).

Convenience alias for getTokenBan - provided for semantic clarity.
Use when you just need to check if a token is banned.

RETURNS: { banned: boolean, ban?: { id, tokenName, reason, bannedBy, createdAt, updatedAt }, tokenName }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth with overseer status.

onTokenBanChanged.name: onTokenBanChanged
onTokenBanChanged.description:
Watch for token ban and unban events in real-time.

Triggers when tokens are banned or unbanned by administrators. Includes:
- TOKEN_BANNED: Token removed from trading/creation due to policy violation
- TOKEN_UNBANNED: Ban lifted, token restored to normal status

Returns:
- tokenBansChanged: Number of ban status change events detected
- events: Array of ban events with tokenName, newBanStatus, reason, and timestamp

Filter Options:
- tokenName: Only watch ban changes for a specific token
- banStatus: Filter by status ('BANNED' or 'UNBANNED').

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Only watch ban changes for this token (optional).

parameters.name: durationSeconds
parameters.description: How long to watch for new events in seconds (default: 60).

fetchMessages.name: fetchMessages
fetchMessages.description:
Query messages with type/tokenName/userAddress filters.

Returns paginated list of messages using cursor-based pagination.
At least one of type, tokenName, or userAddress must be provided.
Public endpoint - no authentication required.

**Filter Combinations:**
- type=CHAT + tokenName â†’ Chat messages for a token
- type=COMMENT + tokenName â†’ Comments for a token
- userAddress â†’ All messages from a user
- type + userAddress â†’ User's messages of a specific type

**Message Fields:**
- id: Unique message ID (for updates/deletes/reactions)
- type: CHAT or COMMENT
- tokenName, tokenImage: Pool information
- userAddress, userProfile: Author information
- content: Message text
- createdAt, updatedAt: Timestamps
- reactions: Reaction counts by emoji type
- flagCount: Number of flags against this message
- holderTier?: Token holder tier badge ({ tier: 0-5, tierName: string })
- isPinned?: Whether this message is pinned (CHAT only)

RETURNS: {
  messages: [...],
  pageInfo: { hasNextPage, endCursor, hasPreviousPage, startCursor }
}

Authentication: None required (public endpoint)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Message type filter (CHAT for chat messages, COMMENT for comments).

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: User address to filter by (eth|... or 0x... format).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

createMessage.name: createMessage
createMessage.description:
Create a new message on a token pool.

Posts a message to the specified token as either a CHAT message or COMMENT.
Messages are stored in the unified pool_messages table.

**Content Limits:**
- CHAT: 1-500 characters
- COMMENT: 1-2000 characters

RETURNS: {
  message: {
    id, type, tokenName, tokenImage, userAddress, userProfile,
    content, createdAt, deletedAt, flagCount, reactions, holderTier?
  }
}

holderTier is present if the author holds tokens ({ tier: 0-5, tierName: string }).

Use the returned id with gala_launchpad_update_message or gala_launchpad_delete_message.

Authentication: Requires JWT session (call gala_launchpad_login first)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Message type (CHAT for chat messages, COMMENT for comments).

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name to post the message to (e.g., "anime").

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Message content (1-500 chars for CHAT, 1-2000 chars for COMMENT).

updateMessage.name: updateMessage

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Message ID in format msg-{timestamp}-{uuid} or chat-{timestamp}-{uuid} (supports both modern and legacy formats).

deleteMessage.name: deleteMessage
deleteMessage.description:
Delete a message.

Soft-deletes a message (CHAT or COMMENT) from the pool.

**Authorization:**
- Message author (JWT auth)
- Pool owner (JWT auth)
- Moderator with MANAGE_CHAT/MANAGE_COMMENTS permission (API key auth)
- Platform overseer

The message remains in the database with deletedAt set (soft delete).

RETURNS: { success: true }

Authentication: Requires JWT session OR API key with MANAGE_CHAT or MANAGE_COMMENTS permission.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Message ID in format msg-{timestamp}-{uuid} or chat-{timestamp}-{uuid} (supports both modern and legacy formats).

getPinnedMessage.name: getPinnedMessage

pinMessage.name: pinMessage
pinMessage.description:
Pin a message to a token's chat.

Only one message can be pinned per token at a time.
Pinning a new message automatically unpins any previously pinned message.

**Authorization:**
- Token owner (JWT auth)
- Moderator with MANAGER or MODERATOR role (JWT or API key)

RETURNS: { success: true }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth (token owner)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the message to pin.

unpinMessage.name: unpinMessage
unpinMessage.description:
Unpin a message from a token's chat.

Removes the pinned status from a message.

**Authorization:**
- Token owner (JWT auth)
- Moderator with MANAGER or MODERATOR role (JWT or API key)

RETURNS: { success: true }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth (token owner)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the message to unpin.

getRestrictedNames.name: getRestrictedNames

updateRestrictedNames.name: updateRestrictedNames
updateRestrictedNames.description:
Update the restricted token names content.

Replaces the entire list with newline-separated words.
Newlines separate individual words to restrict.

**Authorization:** Overseer only (JWT)

RETURNS: { success: true }

addContentReaction.name: addContentReaction
addContentReaction.description:
Add a reaction to a pool message (chat or comment).

Requires JWT or API key authentication.
Adding the same reaction type again is a no-op (idempotent).
Users can have multiple different reaction types on the same message.

RETURNS: { data: { reactions, totalCount }, created: boolean }

Authentication: Requires JWT session (call sdk.login() first).

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Message ID in format msg-{timestamp}-{uuid} or chat-{timestamp}-{uuid} (supports both modern and legacy formats).

parameters.name: reactionType
parameters.description: Type of reaction: heart, fire, laugh, wow, or thumbs_up.

removeContentReaction.name: removeContentReaction
removeContentReaction.description:
Remove a reaction from a pool message.

Requires JWT or API key authentication.
Only the user who created the reaction can remove it.

RETURNS: { success: true }

Authentication: Requires JWT session (call sdk.login() first).

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Message ID in format msg-{timestamp}-{uuid} or chat-{timestamp}-{uuid} (supports both modern and legacy formats).

parameters.name: reactionType
parameters.description: Type of reaction: heart, fire, laugh, wow, or thumbs_up.

addReactionToChatMessage.name: addReactionToChatMessage
addReactionToChatMessage.description:
Add a reaction to a chat message.

Convenience wrapper for addContentReaction specifically for chat messages.

RETURNS: { data: { reactions, totalCount }, created: boolean }

Authentication: Requires JWT session (call sdk.login() first).

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Message ID in format msg-{timestamp}-{uuid} or chat-{timestamp}-{uuid} (supports both modern and legacy formats).

parameters.name: reactionType
parameters.description: Type of reaction: heart, fire, laugh, wow, or thumbs_up.

removeReactionFromChatMessage.name: removeReactionFromChatMessage
removeReactionFromChatMessage.description:
Remove a reaction from a chat message.

Convenience wrapper for removeContentReaction specifically for chat messages.

RETURNS: { success: true }

Authentication: Requires JWT session (call sdk.login() first).

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Message ID in format msg-{timestamp}-{uuid} or chat-{timestamp}-{uuid} (supports both modern and legacy formats).

parameters.name: reactionType
parameters.description: Type of reaction: heart, fire, laugh, wow, or thumbs_up.

addReactionToComment.name: addReactionToComment
addReactionToComment.description:
Add a reaction to a comment.

Convenience wrapper for addContentReaction specifically for comments.

RETURNS: { data: { reactions, totalCount }, created: boolean }

Authentication: Requires JWT session (call sdk.login() first).

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Message ID in format msg-{timestamp}-{uuid} or chat-{timestamp}-{uuid} (supports both modern and legacy formats).

parameters.name: reactionType
parameters.description: Type of reaction: heart, fire, laugh, wow, or thumbs_up.

removeReactionFromComment.name: removeReactionFromComment
removeReactionFromComment.description:
Remove a reaction from a comment.

Convenience wrapper for removeContentReaction specifically for comments.

RETURNS: { success: true }

Authentication: Requires JWT session (call sdk.login() first).

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Message ID in format msg-{timestamp}-{uuid} or chat-{timestamp}-{uuid} (supports both modern and legacy formats).

parameters.name: reactionType
parameters.description: Type of reaction: heart, fire, laugh, wow, or thumbs_up.

getTrades.name: getTrades

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name to filter by (optional if userAddress provided).

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: User address to filter by (optional if tokenName provided).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor from previous response (omit for first page).

parameters.name: txnType
parameters.description: Filter by trade direction (BUY or SELL).

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Filter by date range start (ISO 8601 format, e.g., "2024-01-01").

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Filter by date range end (ISO 8601 format, e.g., "2024-12-31").

onTradeExecuted.name: onTradeExecuted
onTradeExecuted.description:
Watch for new trade execution events in real-time.

Triggers whenever a trade is executed on any token. Includes buy and sell trades.

Returns:
- tradesExecuted: Number of trades detected
- trades: Array of trade events with tokenName, userAddress, tradeType (BUY/SELL), amounts, and timestamp

Filter Options:
- tokenName: Only watch trades for a specific token
- tradeType: Filter by direction ('BUY' or 'SELL')
- minAmount: Only notify about trades >= minAmount
- userAddress: Only watch trades from a specific user address.

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Only watch trades for this token (optional).

parameters.name: tradeType
parameters.description: Only watch BUY or SELL trades (optional).

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: Only watch trades from this user address (optional).

parameters.name: durationSeconds
parameters.description: How long to watch for new events in seconds (default: 60).

getRecentTrades.name: getRecentTrades
getRecentTrades.description:
Get the most recently executed trades with optional filtering.

Returns a list of the latest trades across the platform or filtered by token/user/type.
Useful for market overview, trend analysis, and finding recent market activity.

Filter Options:
- tokenName: Get trades for a specific token
- userAddress: Get trades by a specific user
- tradeType: Get only BUY or SELL trades
- limit: Number of recent trades to return (default: 50, max: 500)

Returns: Array of recent trade events with txnId, txnType, amounts, userAddress, tokenName, and timestamp.

getHolderRank.name: getHolderRank
getHolderRank.description:
Get a user's holder rank and balance for a token.

Returns the user's rank (1 = largest holder), balance, and total holder count.
Useful for understanding a user's position in the holder distribution.

Returns: { rank: number, balance: string, holderCount: number }
Returns null if user is not a holder of the token.

Public endpoint - no authentication required.

getTopHolders.name: getTopHolders
getTopHolders.description:
Get top token holders by balance.

Returns a paginated list of the largest token holders, including their address,
balance, and percentage of total supply. Default returns top 10 holders.

Returns: Array of { address: string, balance: string, percentage: number, rank: number }

Public endpoint - no authentication required.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of top holders to return (default: 10, max: 100).

getHolderCount.name: getHolderCount
getHolderCount.description:
Get holder statistics for a token.

Returns the total number of holders and the total supply across all holders.

Returns: { count: number, totalBalance: string }

Public endpoint - no authentication required.

getHoldersByBalance.name: getHoldersByBalance
getHoldersByBalance.description:
Query holders by balance range.

Returns holders whose balance falls within the specified min/max range.
Useful for analyzing holder distribution across different tiers.

Returns: Array of { address: string, balance: string, percentage: number, rank: number }

Public endpoint - no authentication required.

parameters.name: minBalance
parameters.description: Minimum balance (optional, no floor if not specified).

parameters.name: maxBalance
parameters.description: Maximum balance (optional, no ceiling if not specified).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of holders to return (default: 100).

getHolderHistory.name: getHolderHistory
getHolderHistory.description:
Get recent trade history for a specific holder.

Returns the most recent trades that affected a user's holdings for a token.
Useful for understanding how a holder's position was built up.

Returns: { trades: [{ txnId, txnType, inputAmount, outputAmount, createdAt }], pageInfo: { hasNextPage, endCursor } }

Public endpoint - no authentication required.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of recent trades to return (default: 20).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Pagination cursor for fetching next set of trades.

globalFeedReference.name: globalFeedReference

unsubscribeFromGlobalFeedReference.name: unsubscribeFromGlobalFeedReference

globalFeedStatusReference.name: globalFeedStatusReference

monitorGlobalFeedEventsReference.name: monitorGlobalFeedEventsReference

siteConfigStateReference.name: siteConfigStateReference

emitTradeExecuted.name: emitTradeExecuted
emitTradeExecuted.description:
Emit a trade execution event to token subscribers.

Broadcasts a trade execution event to all connected clients subscribed to a token.
Perfect for notifying traders in real-time when a trade occurs on a token.

**Event Recipients:** All clients subscribed to the token:token_name room

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Trade executed event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name for the trade event (e.g., "anime").

emitBalanceUpdated.name: emitBalanceUpdated
emitBalanceUpdated.description:
Emit a balance update event to a specific user.

Notifies a specific user that their token and/or GALA balances have changed, typically after a trade or transfer.
Perfect for real-time wallet updates after trade execution or token transfers.

**Event Recipients:** The specified user via their user:userAddress room

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Balance updated event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: User wallet address to receive the balance update.

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name for the balance update (e.g., "anime").

parameters.name: changeReason
parameters.description: Optional reason for the balance change (e.g., "Trade executed", "Transfer received").

emitStreamStatus.name: emitStreamStatus
emitStreamStatus.description:
Emit a stream status change event.

Broadcasts a stream status update to all connected clients subscribed to a token.
Use this to notify viewers when a stream goes ACTIVE, IDLE, or DISABLED.

**Status Values:**
- IDLE: Not currently streaming
- ACTIVE: Live stream is active
- DISABLED: Streaming is unavailable

**Event Recipients:** All clients subscribed to the token:token_name room

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Stream status event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name for the stream status (e.g., "anime").

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Stream status: IDLE (not streaming), ACTIVE (live), DISABLED (unavailable).

emitViewerCount.name: emitViewerCount
emitViewerCount.description:
Emit a viewer count update event.

Broadcasts updated viewer count to all connected clients subscribed to a token.
Use this to show real-time viewer metrics during streams.

**Event Recipients:** All clients subscribed to the token:token_name room

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Viewer count event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name for the viewer count update (e.g., "anime").

emitStreamCountdown.name: emitStreamCountdown
emitStreamCountdown.description:
Emit a stream countdown event.

Notifies all subscribers of a token when the next live stream will start.
Perfect for building anticipation and getting viewers ready for a scheduled stream.

**Event Recipients:** All clients subscribed to the token:token_name room, plus globally

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Stream countdown event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name for the stream countdown (e.g., "anime").

parameters.name: nextLiveStreamAt
parameters.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the stream will go live (e.g., "2025-01-22T15:00:00Z").

parameters.name: secondsUntilLive
parameters.description: Optional number of seconds until the stream goes live.

emitChatMessage.name: emitChatMessage
emitChatMessage.description:
Emit a chat message event to token chat subscribers.

Broadcasts a system or admin chat message to all connected clients in a token's chat room.
Perfect for announcements, moderation messages, or system notifications.

**Event Recipients:** All clients subscribed to the token:token_name room

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Chat message event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name for the chat message (e.g., "anime").

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: Sender address or "system" for system messages.

emitChatStatus.name: emitChatStatus
emitChatStatus.description:
Emit a chat status change event (enabled/disabled).

Notifies all subscribers that a token's chat room has been enabled or disabled.
Useful for moderation actions (temporarily closing chat) or reopening after maintenance.

**Event Recipients:** All clients subscribed to the token:token_name room

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Chat status event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name for the chat status change (e.g., "anime").

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether chat is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Optional reason for the status change (e.g., "Moderation pause", "Maintenance complete").

emitTypingIndicator.name: emitTypingIndicator
emitTypingIndicator.description:
Emit a typing indicator event.

Shows which users are currently typing in a token's chat room.
Helps create the perception of real-time conversation (e.g., "3 users typing...").

**Event Recipients:** All clients subscribed to the token:token_name room

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Typing indicator event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name for the chat room (e.g., "anime").

parameters.name: typingUsers
parameters.description: Array of user wallet addresses currently typing.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Optional count of typing users (computed from typingUsers length if not provided).

emitTokenBanned.name: emitTokenBanned
emitTokenBanned.description:
Emit a token banned event.

Broadcasts globally that a token has been banned from the platform.
Notifies all connected clients about the ban for compliance and awareness.

**Event Recipients:** All globally connected clients (broadcast)

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Token banned event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Reason for the ban (e.g., "Scam token detected", "Copyright violation").

parameters.name: bannedBy
parameters.description: Optional wallet address of the admin/moderator who imposed the ban.

parameters.name: nextLiveStreamAt
parameters.description: Optional ISO 8601 timestamp - if provided, indicates when token can be unbanned (for temporary bans).

emitTokenUnbanned.name: emitTokenUnbanned
emitTokenUnbanned.description:
Emit a token unbanned event.

Broadcasts globally that a previously banned token has been unbanned/restored.
Notifies all connected clients that the token is now available again.

**Event Recipients:** All globally connected clients (broadcast)

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Token unbanned event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Optional reason for the unban (e.g., "Appeal approved", "Error in ban decision").

parameters.name: unbannedBy
parameters.description: Optional wallet address of the admin/moderator who lifted the ban.

emitModeratorAdded.name: emitModeratorAdded
emitModeratorAdded.description:
Emit a moderator added event.

Notifies subscribers that a user has been added or promoted to a moderator role.
Useful for transparency and updating the UI with the new moderator information.

**Event Recipients:** All clients subscribed to the token:token_name room

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Moderator added event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name for the moderator addition (e.g., "anime").

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: Wallet address of the user being added as moderator.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Optional reason for adding the moderator (e.g., "Trusted community member", "Promoted for good behavior").

emitModeratorRemoved.name: emitModeratorRemoved
emitModeratorRemoved.description:
Emit a moderator removed event.

Notifies subscribers that a moderator has been removed or demoted from their role.
Useful for transparency and updating the UI with the change in moderator status.

**Event Recipients:** All clients subscribed to the token:token_name room

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Moderator removed event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Token name for the moderator removal (e.g., "anime").

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: Wallet address of the user being removed as moderator.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Optional reason for removing the moderator (e.g., "Inactive for 60 days", "Misconduct").

emitUserProfileUpdated.name: emitUserProfileUpdated
emitUserProfileUpdated.description:
Emit a user profile updated event.

Notifies a specific user that their profile has been updated (e.g., avatar, display name, bio).
Useful for real-time profile synchronization across all their connected sessions/devices.

**Event Recipients:** The specified user via their user:userAddress room

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "User profile updated event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: User wallet address to receive the profile update notification.

parameters.name: updatedFields
parameters.description: Optional array of field names that were updated (e.g., ["fullName", "avatar", "bio"]).

parameters.name: summary
parameters.description: Optional human-readable summary of the changes (e.g., "Profile updated successfully").

emitSiteConfigChanged.name: emitSiteConfigChanged
emitSiteConfigChanged.description:
Emit a site configuration changed event.

Broadcasts globally that the site configuration has changed (e.g., maintenance mode, trading disabled, fees updated).
Notifies all connected clients about platform-wide changes requiring immediate awareness.

**Event Recipients:** All globally connected clients (broadcast)

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Site config changed event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Configuration value (can be any JSON-serializable type: boolean, string, number, object, array, null).

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Optional human-readable description of the config change (e.g., "Scheduled maintenance 3am-4am UTC").

emitFeatureStatus.name: emitFeatureStatus
emitFeatureStatus.description:
Emit a feature status changed event.

Broadcasts globally that a feature's availability has changed (e.g., streaming disabled, trading paused, chat maintenance).
Notifies all connected clients when features are disabled/enabled with optional recovery time.

**Event Recipients:** All globally connected clients (broadcast)

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Feature status event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether the feature is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Optional reason for the status change (e.g., "Service degradation", "Scheduled maintenance", "High load").

parameters.name: nextLiveStreamAt
parameters.description: Optional ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the feature will come back online (if disabled).

emitWebsocketEvent.name: emitWebsocketEvent
emitWebsocketEvent.description:
Emit a generic WebSocket event (advanced/custom use).

For most use cases, use the specific boutique tools like:
- gala_launchpad_emit_trade_executed
- gala_launchpad_emit_chat_message
- gala_launchpad_emit_stream_status
- etc.

This generic tool is for advanced scenarios where you need custom event payloads
or actions not covered by the boutique helpers.

**Event Routing:**
- If tokenName: Routes to token:tokenName room
- If userAddress: Routes to user:userAddress room
- If broadcast=true: Routes to global room

**Payload Format:**
Provide a JSON object with custom event data. Structure depends on your event type.

RETURNS: { success: true, message: "Event emitted" }

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: tokenName
parameters.description: Optional token name for token-scoped events.

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: Optional wallet address for user-scoped events.

parameters.name: broadcast
parameters.description: If true, broadcast to global room (all connected clients).

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Event payload (JSON object with custom data).

getConnectedClients.name: getConnectedClients
getConnectedClients.description:
List currently connected WebSocket clients with optional filtering.

Returns a paginated list of connected WebSocket clients, with optional filters
for room, token, user addresses, authentication status, and connection duration.
Useful for monitoring active connections and targeting specific audiences.

**Query Parameters:**
- room: Filter by room name (e.g., "token:anime")
- tokenName: Shorthand for room=token:{name}
- userAddress: Find specific user (exact match)
- userAddresses: Find any of these users (comma-separated)
- authenticated: Filter by auth status
- isOverseer: Filter by admin/overseer status
- minConnectionSeconds: Only clients connected longer than X seconds
- offset/limit: Pagination

**Connection Info Includes:**
- Socket ID
- Wallet address (if authenticated)
- Authentication status
- Connected rooms (subscribed channels)
- Connection duration
- Last activity timestamp

RETURNS: {
  clients: [
    {
      socketId, address?, authenticated, connectedAt, lastActivity, rooms: [...]
    }
  ],
  summary: {
    totalConnected, authenticatedCount, anonymousCount,
    overseerCount, requestedUsersOnline,
    rooms: [{ room, connectedCount, authenticatedCount }, ...]
  },
  pagination: { offset, limit, total, hasMore }
}

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

parameters.name: userAddresses
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of user addresses to find.

parameters.name: minConnectionSeconds
parameters.description: Only include clients connected longer than X seconds.

isUserOnline.name: isUserOnline
isUserOnline.description:
Check if a specific user is currently connected via WebSocket.

Useful for:
- Determining if a user is online before sending targeted messages
- Checking if a specific user is viewing a token or room
- Validating user connection before emitting user-scoped events

Returns:
{
  online: boolean,
  socketId?: string (if online),
  rooms?: string[] (if online),
  connectedAt?: string (if online)
}

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

getOnlineUsers.name: getOnlineUsers

getTokenViewers.name: getTokenViewers
getTokenViewers.description:
Get list of users currently viewing a specific token.

Useful for:
- Sending targeted announcements to active token watchers
- Checking if there's an audience before broadcasting token events
- Finding authenticated viewers for premium notifications

RETURNS: {
  clients: [list of connected clients],
  count: total viewer count,
  authenticatedCount: count of authenticated viewers
}

Authentication: Requires streamAdminApiKey (admin) OR JWT auth as Overseer

tokenFormats.overview:
The SDK uses TWO distinct token identifier formats depending on the operation type. Using the wrong format will result in runtime errors.

**Format 1: Token Name (Launchpad/Bonding Curve Tokens)**
- Simple lowercase string, 3-20 alphanumeric characters
- Examples: "anime", "demonkpop", "shoewars"
- Used for: Bonding curve operations (before graduation)

**Format 2: TokenClassKey (GalaChain/DEX Tokens)**
- Pipe-delimited string: collection|category|type|additionalKey
- Examples: "GALA|Unit|none|none", "GUSDC|Unit|none|eth:0xa0b..."
- Used for: DEX swaps, LP operations, standard GalaChain tokens

launchpad.description: Simple lowercase token name for Launchpad bonding curve operations. 3-20 lowercase alphanumeric characters.

galachain.description: Pipe-delimited TokenClassKey with 4 components: collection|category|type|additionalKey. The "type" is the token SYMBOL (set at creation), which may differ from tokenName. Required for DEX operations. NEVER construct manually - always query via fetchPools() or resolveTokenClassKey().

methodFormats.notes: Bonding curve only, use simple name
Bonding curve only, use simple name
GALA amount only, no token param

tokenFormats.decisionTree:
Q: What operation am I doing?
â”‚
â”œâ”€â”€ Buying/selling a NEW token (bonding curve)?
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Use tokenName: sdk.buy({ tokenName: 'anime', ... })
â”‚
â”œâ”€â”€ Swapping on DEX (graduated tokens, GALA, GUSDC)?
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Use tokenClassKey: sdk.executeSwap('GALA|Unit|none|none', ...)
â”‚
â”œâ”€â”€ Transferring tokens?
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Launchpad token? â†’ sdk.transferToken({ tokenName: 'anime', ... })
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Standard token? â†’ sdk.transferToken({ tokenId: 'GALA|Unit|none|none', ... })
â”‚
â””â”€â”€ Checking price?
    â””â”€â”€ Either works: sdk.fetchTokenPrice({ tokenName: 'anime' })
                   OR sdk.fetchTokenPrice({ tokenId: 'GALA|Unit|none|none' })

commonMistakes.explanation: DEX operations require full tokenClassKey format with pipe delimiters
Bonding curve operations use simple lowercase token names, not tokenClassKey format

commonMistakes.wrong:
// Constructing tokenClassKey from tokenName
const tokenClassKey = `Token|Unit|${tokenName.toUpperCase()}|client:gala-launchpad`;
commonMistakes.explanation: The tokenClassKey contains the token SYMBOL (set at creation), which may differ from tokenName. Never construct it manually - always query via fetchPools() or resolveTokenClassKey().

commonMistakes.wrong: // Not checking graduation status before choosing operation
commonMistakes.explanation: Always check graduation status to determine which token format and methods to use
